member.summary: The severity level of the case.
member.value: The field can have one of the values listed in the class. The default value is .

member.summary: The priority of the case.
member.value: The field can have one of the values listed in the class. The default value is .

member.summary: The date and time when the case should be closed according to the SLA.

member.summary: The time (in minutes) of the case resolution.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CR.Standalone.CRLead
member.summary: A standalone version of the class used to save changes in the CRLead table. Represents a marketing lead or a sales lead.
member.remarks: A marketing lead is a person or a company that has potential interest in a product your organization offers. A sales lead is a person or a company that expresses interest in products your organization offers. The records are created and edited on the Leads (CR.30.10.00) form, which corresponds to the graph.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CR.CRLead
member.summary: Represents a marketing lead or a sales lead.
member.remarks: A marketing lead is a person or a company that has potential interest in a product your organization offers. A sales lead is a person or a company that expresses interest in products your organization offers. The records of this type are created and edited on the Leads (CR.30.10.00) form, which corresponds to the graph. Note that this class is a projection of the and classes.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CR.Location
member.summary: Represents the location of a business account, a customer or a vendor with specific settings for entities such as sales orders, purchase orders, and invoices.
member.remarks:
An user can specify more than one location for a business acount, a customer, or a vendor, and each location can have specific settings such as the following:
Accounts payable and expense accounts and the corresponding subaccounts
Payment settings and remittance information
Purchasing and shipping-related information
Tax-related information
The records of this type are created and edited on the Account Locations (CR303010), the Customer Locations (AR303020), and the Vendor Locations (AP303010) forms, which correspond to the , the , and the graphs respectively.

member.name: M:PX.Objects.CR.Extensions.ViewExtensions.GetOrCreateSelectFromView``1(PX.Data.PXGraph,System.String,System.Func{PX.Data.PXSelectBase})
member.summary: The method that can be used to create a view from the specified select type or get an existing view with the specified name and create an instance of this select type in both cases as a result.
member.remarks: must be non abstract or to be or . If the provided as than would be returned. If it is non generic than resulting would be for the primary type of existing view, if view doesn't exist either, that it would be for the one lightweight DAC. In both cases if view doesn't exist it is considered as dummy and will return empty array (via view delegate). This method could be helpful if graph extension adds some hidden view that could (but not must) be overriden in multiple child extensions and all such views should be independent of each other. Such views could overriden by the common override views way: just add field of type with name to the any graph extension for specified graph.
member.typeparam: The desired select type, which must be non-abstract or be or . Also it must have a constructor with one parameter of the type.
member.param: The view name on which the desired is based. If this view is not presented in , the new view with this name is created.
The initializer of the desired select. You can provide as and create a concrete select via initializer.
member.returns: The desired select.
member.exception: Is raised if is abstract and is not or or if the desired cannot be instantiated for any reason.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CR.Extensions.SideBySideComparison.CompareEntitiesExt`3
member.summary: The base extension that provides comparison of two sets of items. It shows differences line by line and allows you to select a record from the left or right set ().
member.remarks: The items should be aligned with each other (see ). For instance, it could be use to compare set of and related . Compared entities not have to be of the same type, however it should be presented by same parent type and it must be . For instance, it is possible to compare with , because is a parent of . Use for link (see ) and for merge (see ).
member.typeparam: The entry type.
The primary DAC (a type) of the graph.
The type of that is used by the current extension.

member.summary: The prefix of generic views that is added by the current type of extension.
member.remarks: The property can be used to define hidden views in the base class for different child extensions. The resulting view name is a concatenation of and the 's property name. The property is used to built views for the following selects: , .
member.example: If ViewPrefix is "Prefix_", the following views are created: "Prefix_ComparisonRows" for and "Prefix_VisibleComparisonRows" for .

P:PX.Objects.CA.BankStatementHelpers.MatchSettings.MatchThreshold
member.summary: Absolute Relevance Threshold used in auto-matching of transactions. Document will be matched automatically to a bank transaction if: 1. If it's the only match and Match Relevance > Relative Relevance Threshold 2. There is any number of matches and the best match has Match Relevance > Absolute Relevance Threshold 3. There is any number of matches and Match Relevance of the best match - Match Relevance of the second best match>= Relative Relevance Threshold

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.BankStatementHelpers.MatchSettings.RelativeMatchThreshold
member.summary: Relative Relevance Threshold used in auto-matching of transactions. Document will be matched automatically to a bank transaction if: 1. If it's the only match and Match Relevance > Relative Relevance Threshold 2. There is any number of matches and the best match has Match Relevance > Absolute Relevance Threshold 3. There is any number of matches and Match Relevance of the best match - Match Relevance of the second best match>= Relative Relevance Threshold

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.BankStatementHelpers.MatchSettings.InvoiceFilterByDate

member.summary: This flag is required for the specific situation when SkipVoids is true and transaction was included to Reconcillation Statement before it was voided and then voiding transaction was included.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.TaxCalcMode
member.summary: The tax calculation mode, which defines which amounts (tax-inclusive or tax-exclusive) should be entered in the detail lines of a document. This field is displayed only if the field is set to true.
member.value: The field can have one of the following values: "T" (Tax Settings): The tax amount for the document is calculated according to the settings of the applicable tax or taxes. "G" (Gross): The amount in the document detail line includes a tax or taxes. "N" (Net): The amount in the document detail line does not include taxes.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.HasWithHoldTax
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that withholding taxes are applied to the document. This is a technical field, which is calculated on the fly and is used to restrict the values of the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.HasUseTax
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that use taxes are applied to the document. This is a technical field, which is calculated on the fly and is used to restrict the values of the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.UsesManualVAT
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the document's tax zone is set up as "Manual VAT Zone". This is a technical field, which is used to restrict the values of the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.DontApprove
member.summary: Indicates that the current document should be excluded from the approval process.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.DepositAsBatch
member.summary: When set to true indicates that the transaction can be included in a deposit.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.DepositAfter

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.DepositDate

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.Deposited

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.DepositNbr
member.summary: The reference number of the deposit document.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran
member.summary: Contains the main properties of CA bank transactions and their classes. CA bank transactions are edited on the Process Bank Transactions (CA306000) form (which corresponds to the graph). Also CA bank transactions are edited on the Process Incoming Payments (AR305000) form (which corresponds to the graph).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.CashAccountID
member.summary: The cash account specified on the bank statement for which you want to upload bank transactions. This field is a part of the compound key of the document.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.TranID
member.summary: The unique identifier of the CA bank transaction. This field is the key field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.TranType
member.summary: The type of the bank tansaction. The field is linked to the field.
member.value: The field can have one of the following values: "S": Bank Statement Import, "I": Payments Import

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.HeaderRefNbr
member.summary: The reference number of the imported bank statement (CABankTranHeader), which the system generates automatically in accordance with the numbering sequence assigned to statements on the Cash Management Preferences (CA101000) form.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.ExtTranID
member.summary: The external identifier of the transaction.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.DrCr
member.summary: The balance type of the bank transaction.
member.value: The field can have one of the following values: "D": Receipt, "C": Disbursement

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.CuryID
member.summary: The identifier of currency of the bank transaction.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.CuryInfoID
member.summary: The identifier of the exchange rate record for the bank transaction amount.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.TranDate
member.summary: The transaction date.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.TranEntryDate
member.summary: The bank transaction entry date.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.CuryTranAmt
member.summary: The amount of the bank transaction in the selected currency.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.OrigCuryID
member.summary: The currency of the matching document.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.ExtRefNbr
member.summary: The external reference number of the transaction.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.TranDesc
member.summary: The description of the bank transaction.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.UserDesc
member.summary: The description of the bank transaction. You can use this field to specify a user description of the bank transaction while keeping the original bank description () untouched.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.PayeeName
member.summary: The payee name, if any, specified for a transaction.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.PayeeAddress1
member.summary: The payee address, if any, specified for a transaction.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.PayeeCity
member.summary: The payee city, if any, specified for a transaction.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.PayeeState
member.summary: The payee state, if any, specified for a transaction.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.PayeePostalCode
member.summary: The payee postal code, if any, specified for a transaction.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.PayeePhone
member.summary: The payee phone, if any, specified for a transaction.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.TranCode
member.summary: The external code from the bank.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.OrigModule
member.summary: The original module of the matching document. This field is displayed on the Create Payment tab of on the Process Bank Transactions (CA306000) form.
member.value: The field can have one of the following values: "AP": Accounts Payable, "AR": Accounts Receivable, "CA": Cash Management.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.PayeeBAccountID
member.summary: The vendor or customer associated with the document, by its business account ID. This field is displayed if the "AP" or "AR" option is selected in the field. This field is displayed on the Create Payment tab of on the Process Bank Transactions (CA306000) form.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.PayeeLocationID
member.summary: The location of the vendor or customer. This field is displayed if the "AP" or "AR" option is selected in the field. This field is displayed on the Create Payment tab of on the Process Bank Transactions (CA306000) form.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.PaymentMethodID
member.summary: The payment method used by a customer or vendor for the document. This field is displayed if the "AP" or "AR" option is selected in the field. This field is displayed on the Create Payment tab of on the Process Bank Transactions (CA306000) form.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.PMInstanceID
member.summary: The identifier of the credit card or account that is used by a customer or vendor for the document. This field is displayed on the Create Payment tab of on the Process Bank Transactions (CA306000) form.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.InvoiceInfo
member.summary: The reference number of the document (invoice or bill) generated to match a payment. This field is displayed if the "AP" or "AR" option is selected in the field. This field is displayed on the Create Payment tab of on the Process Bank Transactions (CA306000) form.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.DocumentMatched
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that this bank transaction is matched to the payment and ready to be processed. That is, the bank transaction has been matched to an existing transaction in the system, or details of a new document that matches this transaction have been specified.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.RuleApplied
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the rule was applied to clear the transaction on the Process Bank Transactions (CA306000) form.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.ApplyRuleEnabled
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the button Create Rule is enabled. This is a virtual field and it has no representation in the database.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.MatchedToExisting
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that this bank transaction is matched to the transaction in the system. This is a virtual field and it has no representation in the database.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.MatchedToInvoice
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that this bank transaction is matched to the invoice. This is a virtual field and it has no representation in the database.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.MatchedToExpenseReceipt
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that this bank transaction is matched to the Expense Receipt. This is a virtual field and it has no representation in the database.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.CreateDocument
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that a new payment will be created for the selected bank transactions.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.MultipleMatching
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the selected bank transaction can be matched to multiple invoices.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.MultipleMatchingToPayments
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the selected bank transaction can be matched to multiple payments.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.MatchReceiptsAndDisbursements
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the selected bank transaction can be matched to multiple documents with any amount and any direction.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.Status
member.summary: The status of the bank transaction. This is a virtual field and it has no representation in the database.
member.value: The field can have one of the following values: "M": The bank transaction is matched to the payment and ready to be processed. "I": The bank transaction is matched to the invoice. "C": The bank transactions will be matched to a new payment. "H": The bank transaction is hidden from the statement on the Process Bank Transactions (CA306000) form. string.Empty: The , , , and flags are set to false.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.Processed
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that this bank transaction is processed.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.EntryTypeID
member.summary: The identifier of an entry type that is used as a template for a new cash transaction to be created to match the selected bank transaction. The field is displayed if the CA option is selected in the field. This field is displayed on the Create Payment tab of on the Process Bank Transactions (CA306000) form.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.TaxZoneID
member.summary: The tax zone that applies to the bank transaction.
member.value: Corresponds to the value of the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.TaxCalcMode
member.summary: The tax calculation mode, which defines which amounts (tax-inclusive or tax-exclusive) should be entered in the detail lines of a document. This field is displayed only if the field is set to true.
member.value: The field can have one of the following values: "T" (Tax Settings): The tax amount for the document is calculated according to the settings of the applicable tax or taxes. "G" (Gross): The amount in the document detail line includes a tax or taxes. "N" (Net): The amount in the document detail line does not include taxes.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.ChargeTypeID
member.summary: The identifier of an entry type that is used as a template for a new cash transaction to be created to match the selected bank transaction. The field is displayed if the Multiple Documents option is selected. This field is displayed on the Match to Invoices tab of on the Process Bank Transactions (CA306000) form.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.ChargeTaxZoneID
member.summary: The tax zone that applies to the bank transaction.
member.value: Corresponds to the value of the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTran.ChargeTaxCalcMode
member.summary: The tax calculation mode, which defines which amounts (tax-inclusive or tax-exclusive) should be entered in the detail lines of a document. This field is displayed only if the field is set to true.
member.value: The field can have one of the following values: "T" (Tax Settings): The tax amount for the document is calculated according to the settings of the applicable tax or taxes. "G" (Gross): The amount in the document detail line includes a tax or taxes. "N" (Net): The amount in the document detail line does not include taxes.

member.summary: Identifier of the rule. Database autogenerated identity key.

member.summary: Description of the rule. Does not affect any functionality.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTranRule.BankTranCashAccountID
member.summary: The Cash Account for the rule. When specified, the rule will be applied only to the transactions on this Cash Account.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTranRule.BankDrCr
member.summary: Indicates whether this rule should be applied to receipt or disbursement bank transactions.
member.value: Corresponds to the field. Mandatory.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTranRule.TranCuryID
member.summary: Code of the Currency. If specified, the rule will be applied only to the transactions in the respective currency.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTranRule.AmountMatchingMode
member.summary: The mode of the transaction amount matching.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTranRule.CuryTranAmt
member.summary: Transaction amount in the currency of the transaction. When specified together with appropriate value in the field, the rule will be applied only to the transactions with matching amount. In case the is set to "Between", the value in this field is used as a lower bound for transaction amount.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTranRule.MaxCuryTranAmt
member.summary: Maximum transaction amount in the currency of the transaction, which the rule should match. Used only when the is set to "Between"
member.value: Matching is done on the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTranRule.TranCode
member.summary: The transaction code that the rule should match.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTranRule.BankTranDescription
member.summary: Represents the text used to identify transactions, to which the rule should be applied. Transaction must contain the text in the description.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTranRule.MatchDescriptionCase
member.summary: Indicates whether the case should be matched when the system attempts to apply the rule.
member.value: When set to true the description of the transactions will be scanned for presence of the specified text with respect to case. Otherwise, the case will be ignored during string comparison. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTranRule.UseDescriptionWildcards
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the system must treat '*' and '?' characters in the as wildcards ('*' matches 0 or more arbitrary symbols, '?' matches one arbitrary symbol).
member.value: Defaults to false.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTranRule.DocumentModule
member.summary: The module of the document generated by the rule.
member.value: Default is "CA". Now this is the only supported value. Mandatory.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTranRule.DocumentEntryTypeID
member.summary: Identifier of the of the document generated by the rule.
member.value: Corresponds to the field. Mandatory.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CADeposit.ChargeMult
member.summary: The coefficient of the charge total amount in the calculation of the deposit total amount. The field depends on the field. The field is read-only; it is not displayed on any Acumatica ERP form. This is virtual field and has no representation in the database.
member.value: If the charges for the deposit are specified by a separate transaction (that is, if the field is set to true), the value of the field is "decimal.Zero". If the charges for the deposit are deducted from the deposit amount (that is, if the field is set to false), the value of the field is "decimal.MinusOne".

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CADepositCharge.PaymentMethodID
member.summary: The payment method of the deposited payment to which the charge rate should be applied. This field is a part of the primary key. The field is useful if a bank establishes different charge rates for different payment methods. In the case, when payments with different payment methods are mixed in one deposit, you can group multiple records with different rates by the payment method.
member.value: Corresponds to the value of the field. If the value of the field is an empty string (which is the default value), the charge rate is applied to deposited payments regardless of their payment method.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAExpense.TaxCalcMode
member.summary: The tax calculation mode, which defines which amounts (tax-inclusive or tax-exclusive) should be entered in the detail lines of a document. This field is displayed only if the field is set to true.
member.value: The field can have one of the following values: "T" (Tax Settings): The tax amount for the document is calculated according to the settings of the applicable tax or taxes. "G" (Gross): The amount in the document detail line includes a tax or taxes. "N" (Net): The amount in the document detail line does not include taxes.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.RequireControlTotal
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the Control Total box is added to the Summary area of the Transactions (CA304000) form, so a user can enter the transaction amount manually. This amount will be validated when users enter transactions.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.RequireControlTaxTotal
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the Tax Amount box is added to the Summary area of the Transactions (CA304000) form, so a user can enter the tax amount manually in the transaction.

member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that newly entered transactions will by default get the On Hold status on entry.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.ReleaseAP
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that Accounts Payable documents can be released from the Cash Management module. If the value of the field is false, Accounts Payable documents can be released only from the Accounts Payable module.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.ReleaseAR
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that Accounts Receivable documents can be released from the Cash Management module. If the value of the field is false, Accounts Receivable documents can be released only from the Accounts Receivable module.

member.summary: For the system to categorize a cash transaction as matching, the maximum number of days between the date of a cash transaction (receipt) and the selected transaction on the bank statement.

member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that credit memo are available for matching to bank transactions on the Process Bank Transactions (CA306000) form.

member.summary: The relative weight of the evaluated difference between the reference numbers of the bank transaction and the cash transaction.

member.summary: The relative weight of the evaluated difference between the dates of the bank transaction and the cash transaction.

member.summary: The average number of days for a payment to be cleared with the bank.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.DateSigma
member.summary: The number of days before and after the average delay date during which 50% of payments are generally cleared.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.EmptyRefNbrMatching
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that batch payments with empty ref number are available for matching to bank transactions on the Process Bank Transactions (CA306000) form.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.IgnoreCuryCheckOnImport
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the system ignores the currency check when you import bank statements.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.ImportToSingleAccount
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that importing a bank statement from a file should be performed to only a specific cash account. The user can import the data only after the user has selected the cash account on the Import Bank Transactions (CA306500) form.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.AllowEmptyFITID
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the system ignores the empty FITID value (the value, which is uploaded to the Ext. Tran. ID column on the Import Bank Transactions (CA306500) form) when you import the bank statement file.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.AllowMatchingToUnreleasedBatch
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that unreleased batch payments are available for matching to bank transactions on the Process Bank Transactions (CA306000) form.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.UnknownPaymentEntryTypeID

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.StatementImportTypeName
member.summary: The service to be used for importing bank statements if the Import Bank Statements to Single Cash Account check box is cleared.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.SkipVoided

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.SkipReconciled

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.MatchThreshold
member.summary: Absolute Relevance Threshold used in auto-matching of transactions. Document will be matched automatically to a bank transaction if: 1. If it's the only match and Match Relevance > Relative Relevance Threshold 2. There is any number of matches and the best match has Match Relevance > Absolute Relevance Threshold 3. There is any number of matches and Match Relevance of the best match - Match Relevance of the second best match>= Relative Relevance Threshold

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.RelativeMatchThreshold
member.summary: Relative Relevance Threshold used in auto-matching of transactions. Document will be matched automatically to a bank transaction if: 1. If it's the only match and Match Relevance > Relative Relevance Threshold 2. There is any number of matches and the best match has Match Relevance > Absolute Relevance Threshold 3. There is any number of matches and Match Relevance of the best match - Match Relevance of the second best match>= Relative Relevance Threshold

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.InvoicePayeeCompareWeight

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CashAccount.MatchThreshold
member.summary: Absolute Relevance Threshold used in auto-matching of transactions. Document will be matched automatically to a bank transaction if: 1. If it's the only match and Match Relevance > Relative Relevance Threshold 2. There is any number of matches and the best match has Match Relevance > Absolute Relevance Threshold 3. There is any number of matches and Match Relevance of the best match - Match Relevance of the second best match>= Relative Relevance Threshold

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CashAccount.RelativeMatchThreshold
member.summary: Relative Relevance Threshold used in auto-matching of transactions. Document will be matched automatically to a bank transaction if: 1. If it's the only match and Match Relevance > Relative Relevance Threshold 2. There is any number of matches and the best match has Match Relevance > Absolute Relevance Threshold 3. There is any number of matches and Match Relevance of the best match - Match Relevance of the second best match>= Relative Relevance Threshold

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CA.CashAccountDeposit
member.summary: Contains the main properties of Clearing Accounts. Records defines a settings for deposit to the cash account from the clearing account(s). The presence of this record for the specific Cash Account /Deposit Account pair defines a possibility to post to Cash Account from the specific cash account. Clearing Accounts are edited on the Cash Accounts (CA202000) form (which corresponds to the graph) on the tab Clearing Accounts.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CashAccountDeposit.PaymentMethodID
member.summary: The payment method of the deposited payment to which this charge rate should be applied. If the field is filled by empty string (default), the charge rate is applied to deposited payments, regardless of their payment method. Corresponds to the value of the field.

member.summary: The rate of the specified charges (expressed as a percent of the deposit total).

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CA.DynamicValueValidationAttribute
member.summary:
This attribute allows to provide a dynamic validation rules for the field.
The rule is defined as regexp and may be stored in some external field.
In the costructor, one should provide a search method for this rule.

example.code: [DynamicValueValidation(typeof(Search<PaymentMethodDetail.validRegexp, Where<PaymentMethodDetail.paymentMethodID, Equal<Current<VendorPaymentMethodDetail.paymentMethodID>>, And<PaymentMethodDetail.detailID, Equal<Current<VendorPaymentMethodDetail.detailID>>>>>))]

member.name: M:PX.Objects.CA.DynamicValueValidationAttribute.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Ctor
member.param: Must be IBqlSearch returning a validation regexp.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CA.PXDBStringWithMaskAttribute
member.summary:
This attribute defines a PXDBStringAttribute with a dynamically created entry mask
Should be used, when the entry mask must be set during a runtime, rather then at compile-time
May be combined with the DynamicValueValidationAttribute

example.code: [PXDBStringWithMask(255, typeof(Search<PaymentMethodDetail.entryMask, Where<PaymentMethodDetail.paymentMethodID, Equal<Current<VendorPaymentMethodDetail.paymentMethodID>>, And<PaymentMethodDetail.detailID, Equal<Current<VendorPaymentMethodDetail.detailID>>>>>),IsUnicode = true)]

member.name: M:PX.Objects.CA.PXDBStringWithMaskAttribute.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Type)
member.summary: Calls the default constructor of the PXDBString
member.param: Length of the string in the database. Passed to PXDBString.
Must be a IBqlSearch type returning a valid mask expression

member.name: M:PX.Objects.CA.PXDBStringWithMaskAttribute.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Calls the default constructor of the PXDBString
member.param: Must be a IBqlSearch type returning a valid mask expression

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CA.PXRSACryptStringWithMaskAttribute
member.summary:
This as a specialized version of PXRSACryptStringAttribute
which allows to define entry mask dynamically. Works identically to the PXDBStringWithMask
and PXRSACryptString attributes - namely providing run-time entry mask definition for the crypted strings.

example.code: [PXRSACryptStringWithMaskAttribute(1028, typeof(Search<PaymentMethodDetail.entryMask, Where<PaymentMethodDetail.paymentMethodID, Equal<Current<CustomerPaymentMethodDetail.paymentMethodID>>, And<PaymentMethodDetail.detailID, Equal<Current<CustomerPaymentMethodDetail.detailID>>>>>), IsUnicode = true)]

member.summary: Identifier of the , to which the batch belongs.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.Module
member.summary: Key field. The code of the module, to which the batch belongs.
member.value: Allowed values are: "GL", "AP", "AR", "CM", "CA", "IN", "DR", "FA", "PM", "TX", "SO", "PO".

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.BatchNbr
member.summary: Key field. Auto-generated unique number of the batch.
member.value: The number is generated from the Numbering Sequence specified in the setup record of the , to which the batch belongs. For example, the numbering sequence for the batches belonging to the General Ledger module is specified in the field. For other modules see corresponding setup DACs.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.LedgerID
member.summary: Identifier of the , to which the batch belongs.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.DateEntered
member.summary: The date of the batch, specified by user.
member.value: Defaults to the current Business Date.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.FinPeriodID
member.summary: Identifier of the Financial Period, to which the batch belongs.
member.value: By default the period is deducted from the date of the batch. Can be overriden by user.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.BatchType
member.summary: The type of the batch.
member.value: Allowed values are: "H" - Normal, "R" - Recurring, "C" - Consolidation, "T" - Trial Balance, "RCL" - Reclassification, "A" - Allocation. Defaults to "H" - Normal.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.NumberCode
member.summary: The identifier of the record used to assign an auto-generated to the batch.
member.value: Corresponds to the field. The number codes are assigned by the and graphs, which allows to have separate numbering sequences for recurring and allocation batches.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.RefNbr
member.summary: Auto-generated reference number assigned to the batch according to the Numbering Sequence specified in the field of the corresponding record (see the field).
member.value: The field will remain empty if is not set for the batch.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.Status
member.summary: The read-only status of the batch.
member.value: The value of this field is determined by the , , , and fields. Possible values are: "H" - Hold "B" - Balanced "U" - Unposted "P" - Posted "C" - Completed "V" - Voided "R" - Released "Q" - Partially Released "S" - Scheduled

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.CuryDebitTotal
member.summary: The total debit amount of the batch in its currency.
member.value: See also .

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.CuryCreditTotal
member.summary: The total credit amount of the batch in its currency.
member.value: See also .

members.member:
The control total of the batch in its currency.
See also .

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.DebitTotal
member.summary: The total debit amount of the batch in the base currency of the company.
member.value: See also .

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.CreditTotal
member.summary: The total credit amount of the batch in the base currency of the company.
member.value: See also .

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.ControlTotal
member.summary: The control total of the batch in the base currency of the company.
member.value: See also .

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.CuryInfoID
member.summary: Identifier of the CurrencyInfo record associated with the batch.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.AutoReverse
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the batch is auto-reversing. For a batch of this kind the system automatically generates a reversing batch in the next period. The reversing batch is generated either when the original batch is posted or when it is released, depending on the value of the field of the GL preferences record.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.AutoReverseCopy
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the batch is a reversing batch. See also the and fields.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.OrigModule
member.summary: The module, to which the original batch (e.g. the one reversed by this batch) belongs.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.OrigBatchNbr
member.summary: The number of the original batch (e.g. the one reversed by this batch).
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.Released
member.summary: Indicates whether the batch has been released.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.Posted
member.summary: Indicates whether the batch has been posted.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.RequirePost
member.summary: Indicates whether the batch is required to be posted.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.PostErrorCount
member.summary: Indicates how many times system has failed while posting batch.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.Draft
member.summary: When set to true, indicates the the batch is a draft. The drafts of batches are not displayed in the Journal Transactions screen.
member.value: This field is set to true by the Journal Vouchers (GL.30.40.00) screen ( graph) when a new defining a transactions batch is created. This allows to reserve a number for the batch, while not showing it in the interface until the is released and the batch is actually created. Outside Journal Vouchers defaults to false.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.LineCntr
member.summary: The counter of the document lines, used internally to assign consistent numbers to newly created lines. It is not recommended to rely on this field to determine the exact count of lines, because it might not reflect the latter under some conditions.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.CuryID
member.summary: The code of the Currency of the batch.
member.value: Defaults to the base currency of the company.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.ScheduleID
member.summary: Identifier of the , associated with the batch.
member.value: If is true for the batch, then this field provides the identifier of the schedule, into which the batch is included as a template. Otherwise, the field is set to the identifier of the schedule that produced the batch. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.NoteID
member.summary: Identifier of the Note object, associated with the document.
member.value: Corresponds to the Note.NoteID field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.Hold
member.summary: Indicates whether the batch is on hold.
member.value: Defaults to true, if the flag is set in the preferences of the module, and to false otherwise.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.Scheduled
member.summary: When true, indicates that the batch is included as a template into a pointed to by the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.Voided
member.summary: Indicates whether the batch has been voided.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.Description
member.summary: The description of the batch.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.CreateTaxTrans
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the system must generate tax transactions for the batch.
member.value: This field is taken into account only if the feature is on. Affects only those batches, which belong to the General Ledger . Defaults to false.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.SkipTaxValidation
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the system should not validate the tax transactions associated with the batch.
member.value: The value of this field is relevant only if is true.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.ReverseCount
member.summary: The read-only field, reflecting the number of batches in the system, which reverse this batch.
member.value: This field is populated only by the graph (corresponds to the Journal Transactions GL.30.10.00 screen).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.HasRamainingAmount
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the batch has a detail with the visible field.
member.value: This field is populated only by the graph (corresponds to the Journal Transactions GL.30.10.00 screen).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.DontApprove
member.summary: Indicates that the current document should be excluded from the approval process. Maintenance of this property is on graph level.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.GL.FinYearSetup
member.summary: Represents the Financial Year setup record used to define the template for the actual Financial Years. The system stores one record of this type per company. It is edited through the Financial Year (GL.10.10.00) form.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinYearSetup.FirstFinYear
member.summary: First financial year, for which data is stored in the system.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinYearSetup.BegFinYear
member.summary: The start date of the financial year.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinYearSetup.FinPeriods
member.summary: The number of financial periods in the year.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinYearSetup.PeriodLength
member.summary: Obsolete field. The length of periods of the year in days.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinYearSetup.PeriodType
member.summary: The type of financial periods that make up the year.
member.value: Allowed values are: "MO" - Month, "BM" - Two Months, "QR" - Quarter, "WK" - Week, "BW" - Two Weeks, "FW" - Four Weeks, "DC" - Decade, "FF" - 4-4-5 Weeks, "FI" - 4-5-4 Weeks, "IF" - 5-4-4 Weeks, "CL" - Customer Periods Length, "CN" - Custom Number of Periods.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinYearSetup.UserDefined
member.summary: The read-only field indicating whether the periods of the year can be modified by user.
member.value: Depends on the value of the field - returns true if the is "CN" (Custom number of periods).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinYearSetup.PeriodsStartDate
member.summary: The start date of the first period of the year.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinYearSetup.HasAdjustmentPeriod
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the system generates an additional period for posting adjustments. The adjustment period has the same start and end date and is the last period of the year. No date in the year corresponds to the adjustment period, so it can be selected for a particular document or batch only manually. See also the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinYearSetup.EndYearCalcMethod
member.summary: The method used to determine the end date of a year with week-long periods.
member.value: Available values are: "CA" - Last day of the financial year, "LD" - Include last selected day of week of the year, "ND" - Include selected day of week, nearest tot the end of the year. For more information on these options see the documentation for the Financial Year (GL.10.10.00) page of the system.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinYearSetup.EndYearDayOfWeek
member.summary: The day of the week when period starts. Relevant only for the period types based on weeks.
member.value: Allowed values are: 1 - "Sunday", 2 - "Monday", 3 - "Tuesday", 4 - "Wednesday", 5 - "Thursday", 6 - "Friday", 7 - "Saturday".

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinYearSetup.YearLastDayOfWeek
member.summary: The day of the week of the last day of the financial year. Relevant ony for the period types based on weeks and if the is not "CA" - Last day of the financial year.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinYearSetup.AdjustToPeriodStart
member.summary: When set to true, tells the system to align the start and end dates of the periods with the start and end dates of the corresponding calendar periods. Relevant only for Month ("MO"), Two Months ("BM") and Quarter ("QR") period types.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinYearSetup.BelongsToNextYear
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the system must set the financial year to the one, following the year of the selected start date of the year.
member.value: For example, if the selected start date is 10/28/2014 and this option is set to true, the will be 2015. If this option is set to false, for the same date will be 2014.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinYearSetup.IsFixedLengthPeriod
member.summary: When true, indicates that the length of the periods of the year in days is fixed. Read-only field.
member.value: The value of this field is determined by the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinYearSetup.FPType
member.summary: Internal type of periods of the year. Read-only field.
member.value: The value of this field is determined by the field.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine
member.summary:
Represents a budget article. The class is used for both group (see ) and leaf articles. To maintain tree structure, the class stores a link to the parent budget article in the field.
The budget article holds the amount allocated to a particular account-subaccount pair (or a group of accounts and subaccounts, such as ) for a particular year. Distribution of this amount between the periods of the year is stored in the corresponding records.
Records of this type are created on the Budgets (GL302010) form (see the graph) either manually or by the preload mechanism that creates GLBudgetLine from records."/>

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.GroupID
member.summary: The unique identifier of the budget article. This field is a part of the compound key.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.ParentGroupID
member.summary: The identifier of the parent budget article. This field is a part of the compound key.
member.value: Corresponds to the field of the parent. The value is equal to for the nodes on the first level of the tree.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.IsGroup
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the budget article represents a group of other articles. That is, the article has child articles, which are linked to this article by their field.

members.member: Specifies (if set to true) that the budget article was created from a budget tree configuration node by the budget tree preload process. (The preload process is invoked when a user creates a budget for a new year (see ) or converts an existing budget (see ).)

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.BranchID
member.summary: The identifier of the branch to which the budget article belongs. This field is a part of the compound key.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.LedgerID
member.summary: The identifier of the ledger to which the budget article belongs. This field is a part of the compound key.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.FinYear
member.summary: The financial year to which the budget article belongs. This field is a part of the compound key.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.AccountID
member.summary: The identifier of the GL account of the budget article.
member.value: Corresponds to the field. The value of the field can be empty for the group articles (see ).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.SubID
member.summary: The identifier of the GL subaccount of the budget article.
member.value: Corresponds to the field. Can be empty for the group articles (see ).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.Description
member.summary: The description of the budget article.
member.value: Defaults to the description of the account, but can be overwritten by user.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.Amount
member.summary: The amount that is budgeted for the article for a particular year.
member.value: The value can be edited by a user and indicates the decision to allocate the specified amount to the particular budget article. After the article is released, the amount can still be edited. If the amount is changed, the article will be marked as unreleased (see ) and can be released again, which will result in updating the budget ledger figures to match the current state of the article.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.AllocatedAmount
member.summary: The total amount of the budget article distributed between the periods of the year.
member.value: The value of this field is calculated as a sum of amounts of the detail lines of the budget article (see ) and cannot be edited by a user. A budget article cannot be released until its and are equal to each other.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.ReleasedAmount
member.summary: The currently released amount of the article, which matches the figures in the budget ledger.
member.value: This field is updated with the value of the field upon release of the budget article. The difference between the values of this field and the field shows the difference between the current state of the article and the corresponding figures in the budget ledger.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.AccountMask
member.summary: For a group article (see ), defines the mask for selection of the child budget articles by their accounts. The selector on the field of the child articles allows only accounts whose matches the specified mask.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.SubMask
member.summary: For a group article (see ), defines the mask for selection of the child budget articles by their subaccounts. The selector on the field of the child articles allows only subaccounts whose matches the specified mask.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.Released
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the budget article has been released at least once. A released article can be released again if its is not equal to its .

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.WasReleased
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the article was released at least once. Different from in that the latter will be reset to false upon edits of a released article, while this field will still be true even if the article can be released again.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.GroupMask
member.summary: The group mask showing which restriction groups the budget article belongs to. The value of this field is inherited from the group mask of the corresponding budget tree node, because access to budgets is managed through the budget tree configuration.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.TreeSortOrder
member.summary: An integer field that defines the order in which group budget articles (see ) that belong to one parent appear relative to each other in the tree view.
member.value: The value of this field is automatically assigned during budget tree preload from of the corresponding tree node.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.SortOrder
member.summary: The internal field that defines the order in which non-group budget articles appear relative to each other.
member.value: This field is populated only in the graph and is not stored in the database.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.Cleared
member.summary: The field is reserved for internal use.

member.summary: The currently released amount for the specified financial period.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetTree
member.summary:
Represents a node in the template budget structure. The structure defines the tree of budget articles and is used when articles are preloaded into a new budget (see ). Records of this type don't maintain any budget amounts and are used only to define the structure of a budget, which, however, can be altered in any budget for a particular ledger, branch and year.
The class is used for both group (see ) and leaf nodes. To maintain tree structure, the class stores a link to the parent node in the field.
Records of this type are created on the Budget Configuration (GL205000) form (see the graph).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetTree.GroupID
member.summary: The unique identifier of the budget tree node.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetTree.ParentGroupID
member.summary: The identifier of the parent budget tree node.
member.value: Corresponds to the field. The value is equal to for the nodes on the first level of the tree.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetTree.SortOrder
member.summary: An integer field that defines the order in which budget tree nodes that belong to one parent appear relative to each other. The value of this field is changed by users when they move budget tree nodes by using the corresponding actions on the Budget Configuration (GL205000) form.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetTree.IsGroup
member.summary: The identifier of the GL account of the budget tree node.
member.value: The value of the field can be empty for the group nodes(see).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetTree.AccountID
member.summary: Identifier of the GL of the budget tree node. May be empty for the group (see ) nodes.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetTree.Description
member.summary: The description of the budget tree node.
member.value: Defaults to the description of the account, but can be overwritten by a user.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetTree.SubID
member.summary: The identifier of the GL subaccount of the budget tree node.
member.value: Corresponds to the field. The value of the field can be empty for the group (see ) nodes.

member.summary: For a group node (see ), defines the mask for selection of the child budget tree nodes by their subaccounts. The selector on the field of the child nodes allows only subaccounts, whose matches the specified mask.

member.summary: An unbound field that indicates (if set to true) that access to the budget tree node is restricted, because the node is included into a restriction group or groups.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.GL.GLHistoryByPeriod
member.summary: The DAC used to simplify selection and aggregation of proper records on various inquiry and processing screens of the General Ledger module. The main purpose of this DAC is to close the gaps in GL history records, which appear in case GL history records do not exist for every financial period defined in the system. To close these gaps, this projection DAC calculates the last activity period for every existing financial period, so that inquiries and reports that produce information for a given financial period can look at the latest available record.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup
member.summary: Provides access to the preferences of the General Ledger module. Can be edited by user through the General Ledger Preferences (GL.10.20.00) screen.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.YtdNetIncAccountID
member.summary: Identifier of the Year-to-Date Net Income . The account tracks net income accumulated since the beginning of the financial year. It is updated by every transaction posted in the system. The account must not be changed after any journal transactions have been posted.
member.value: Corresponds to the field. Only Accounts of type Liability ("L") can be specified as YTD Net Income account.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.RetEarnAccountID
member.summary: Identifier of the Retained Earnings . The account is updated by the amount accumulated on the YTD Net Income account during the financial year closing.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.AutoRevOption
member.summary: Determines when the system generates reversing batches.
member.value: Possible values are: "P" - On Post and "C" - On Period Closing. Default value is On Post.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.AutoRevEntry
member.summary: Determines whether the system creates negative entries when reversing a . If set to true, the transactions of the reversing batch will retain the Debit/Credit amounts of the original transactions, but with opposite signs. If set to false, the transactions of the reversing batch will retain the sign of the original amounts, but will have them on the opposite sides of Debit/Credit.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.AutoPostOption
member.summary: Determines whether the system must automatically post Batches once they are released. When this option is set to true there won't be any batches with status Unposted in the system.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.COAOrder
member.summary: Determines the order of Accounts in the reports of the General Ledger module.
member.value: Allowed values are: 0 - 1.Assets, 2.Liabilities, 3.Income and Expenses 1 - 1.Assets, 2.Liabilities, 3.Income, 4.Expenses 2 - 1.Income, 2. Expenses, 3. Assets, 4.Liabilities 3 - 1.Income and Expenses, 2. Assets, 3.Liabilities 128 - Custom order. If the last option is selected, the order of accounts is determined by the COAOrder field of the individual Accounts. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.RequireControlTotal
member.summary: Indicates whether the system must enforce validation of batch control totals on Journal Transactions (GL.30.10.00) screen.
member.value: When set to true the control total and debit/credit total of batches must match and user won't be able to save the batch until this condition is met. Otherwise, validation is performed only after clearing the Hold flag on the Batch. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.RequireRefNbrForTaxEntry
member.summary: Indicates whether the Reference Number fields are required on Journal Transactions (GL.30.10.00) screen in case of entering Gl transactions with taxes.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.PostClosedPeriods
member.summary: Determines whether the system allows to post transactions to closed Financial Periods. If set to false, the system raises an error on attempts to enter or post transactions into a closed period.
member.value: Defaults to false.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.BatchNumberingID
member.summary: The identifier of the Numbering Sequence used for batches.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.DocBatchNumberingID
member.summary: The identifier of the Numbering Sequence used for batches of documents created using the Journal Vouchers (GL.30.40.00) form. See the DAC.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.TBImportNumberingID
member.summary: The identifier of the Numbering Sequence used for imports of trial balances. See the DAC.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.AllocationNumberingID
member.summary: The identifier of the Numbering Sequence used for allocations. See the DAC.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.ScheduleNumberingID
member.summary: The identifier of the Numbering Sequence used for schedules. See the DAC.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.HoldEntry
member.summary: Determines whether the system must set the Hold flag and Status On Hold when creating new batches.
member.value: Defaults to true.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.VouchersHoldEntry
member.summary: Determines whether the system must set the Hold flag and Status On Hold when creating new vouchers.
member.value: Defaults to true.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.ConsolSegmentId
member.summary: The identifier of the Segment of the Subaccount segmented key, whose values denote the consolidation unit in the subaccounts of the parent company. Controls the selector on the field.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.PerRetainTran
member.summary: Determines the number of periods the system will keep the transactions in the database.
member.value: Defaults to 99.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.DefaultSubID
member.summary: Identifier of the Subaccount to be used as the default one with Accounts, which have the NoSubDetail field set to true.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.TrialBalanceSign
member.summary: Determines whether the system should automatically change the sign of the trial balance when importing data. Also affects the way trial balance is displayed on reports and inquiries.
member.value: Allowed values are: "N" - Normal - the system doesn't change the signs of balances of expense and income accounts on import. On reports and inquiries all the accounts are grouped by account type. "R" - Reversed - the system reverses the signs of balances of expense and income accounts on import. On reports and inquiries all the accounts except for the Year-to-Date Net Income account are listed. Defaults to "N".

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.ReuseRefNbrsInVouchers
member.summary: Determines whether the reference numbers for documents created on the Journal Vouchers (GL.30.40.00) form) are reused in case the number was allocated for the document that was not persisted, or the document was deleted thus freeing the reference number. When set to true, the system will pick up the free numbers from such documents when creating new entries on the mentioned form. (Note: this may lead to non-linear numbering.) Otherwise the form will always assign new numbers to the documents even if there are reusable ones.
member.value: Defaults to true.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetupApproval.BatchType

member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTran.TaskID
member.summary: Identifier of the Task associated with the transaction. The field is relevant only if the Projects module has been activated.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTran.RefNbr
member.summary: The reference number of the transaction.
member.value: Defaults to the reference number of the batch. Can be overriden by user.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTran.InventoryID
member.summary: Identifier of the Inventory Item, associated with the transaction.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTran.UOM

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTran.Qty
member.summary: The quantity of the transaction.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTran.DebitAmt
member.summary: The debit amount of the transaction. Given in the base currency of the company. See also the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTran.CreditAmt
member.summary: The credit amount of the transaction. Given in the base currency of the company. See also the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTran.CuryInfoID
member.summary: Identifier of the CurrencyInfo object associated with the transaction.
member.value: Auto-generated. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTran.CuryDebitAmt
member.summary: The debit amount of the transaction. Given in the currency of the batch. See also the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTran.CuryCreditAmt
member.summary: The credit amount of the transaction. Given in the currency of the batch. See also the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTran.Released
member.summary: Indicates whether the transaction has been released.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTran.Posted
member.summary: Indicates whether the transaction has been posted.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTran.NonBillable
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the transaction is non-billable in the Project This means that when releasing the batch the system will set the field of the project transaction generated from this transaction to false. This field is relevant only if the Projects module has been activated and integrated with the General Ledger module.
member.value: Defaults to false.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTran.IsInterCompany
member.summary: When true, indicates that the transaction is an inter-branch transaction.
member.value: Defaults to false.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTran.SummPost
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the system must summarize the transaction with other ones when posting. In this case all transactions being posted are grouped by Account and Subaccount. Then, the amounts are summarized and a single transaction is created for each group.
member.value: Defaults to false.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTran.ZeroPost
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the system must post the transaction even if its amounts are equal to zero.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTran.OrigModule
member.summary: The module, to which the original batch (e.g. the one reversed by the parent batch of this transaction) belongs.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.GL.GLTranCode
member.summary: Represents Voucher Entry Code, used to create a document of GL, AP, AR or CA module as a part of a GL Document Batch. User can manage records of this type on the Voucher Entry Codes (GL.10.60.00) page of the system.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTranCode.Module
member.summary: The code of the module where a document or transaction will be generated according to this entry code.
member.value: Allowed values are: "GL", "AP", "AR" and "CA".

member.summary: The type of the document or transaction generated according to the code.
member.value: Allowed values set depends on the selected .

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTranCode.TranCode
member.summary: !REV! The unique voucher code for the selected and Type of the document. The code is selected by user on the Journal Vouchers (GL.30.40.00) screen ( field) when entering the lines of the batch and determines the module and type of the document or transaction to be created from the corresponding line of the document batch. Identifies the record of this DAC associated with a line of a document batch. Only one code can be created for any combination of and Document/Transaction Type.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTranCode.Descr
member.summary: Description of the entry code.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTranCode.Active
member.summary: Indicates whether the entry code is active. Only active codes can be used to create documents or transactions.
member.value: Defaults to true. If set to false, the entry code won't appear in the list of available codes for the field.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.GL.GLTranDoc
member.summary: Represents a line of a GL document batch and contains all information required to create the corresponding document or transaction. Records of this type appear in the details grid of the Journal Vouchers (GL.30.40.00) page.

member.value: Defaults to the value of the field of the parent batch. This field is not supposed to be changed directly. Possible values are: "GL", "AP", "AR", "CM", "CA", "IN", "DR", "FA", "PM", "TX", "SO", "PO".

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTranDoc.BatchNbr

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.JournalEntry.created
member.summary:
The collection of batches created during the current long-running operation. The collection serves the following two purposes: 1. If the feature is activated, the collection stores the list of batches to which transactions can be added during the current operation. 2. If the setting is activated, the collection stores the list of batches that should be posted after release.
!!!WARNING!!! If persisting of some was interrupted by some reason, this collection may store inconsistent state of .

member.name: M:PX.Objects.GL.PostGraph.UpdateHistory(PX.Objects.GL.GLTran,PX.Objects.GL.Account,System.String,PX.Objects.GL.PostGraph.HistoryUpdateAmountType,PX.Objects.GL.PostGraph.HistoryUpdateMode)
member.summary: This method will return without executing if returns false.

summary.para: If we validate records from the first period of the year, the validation year's retained earnings beginning balance will be deleted by validation process and needs to be restored from the previous year's accumulated net income.

In addition to that, customers who upgrade from legacy Acumatica versions without the 's automatic year closing (see ), this method ensures that even if the customer starts GL validation immediately after upgrade, the year preceding the validation period is closed.

Used during GL integrity check procedure. By inserting relevant zero records with = false, this function ensures the transfer of the previous period's Net Income amounts to the retained earnings beginning balance of the subsequent year by the query inside .

If we validate records from the second or later period of the year, the following year's retained earnings beginning balance will not be calculated completely by during processing, and we also need to transfer the accumulated net income from the previous period.

summary.param: The latest period of the financial year from which the accumulated net income amounts should be transferred to the next year's beginning RE balances by 's year closing query.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.Currency
member.summary: Stores financial settings associated with currencies, thus complementing the DAC type. While holds only general information, such as code and precision, the DAC provides information on all accounts and subaccounts associated with a particular currency, such as the Realized Gain and Loss account and subaccount. The DAC also exposes fields with general currency information (such as ), which are mapped to the corresponding fields in the DAC by means of . The records of this type (as well as the records) are edited on the Currencies (CM202000) form (which corresponds to the graph).

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyInfo
member.summary: Stores currency and exchange rate information for a particular document or transaction. Usually, there is an individual record of this type for each document or transaction that involves monetary amounts and supports multi-currency. The documents store a link to their instance of CurrencyInfo in the CuryInfoID field, such as . The exchange rate data for objects of this type is either entered by user or obtained from the records. Records of this type are either created automatically by the or explicitly inserted by the application code (such as in ). User must not be aware of existence of these records.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyInfo.CuryInfoID
member.summary: Key field. Database identity. Unique identifier of the Currency Info object.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyInfo.ModuleCode
P:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyInfo.IsReadOnly
member.summary: When set to true, the system won't allow user to change the fields of this object.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyInfo.BaseCalc
member.summary: When true, indicates that the system must calculate the amounts in the base currency for the related document or transaction. Otherwise the changes in the amounts expressed in the currency of the document won't result in an update to the amounts in base currency.
member.value: Defaults to true.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyInfo.BaseCuryID
member.summary: Identifier of the base .
member.value: Defaults to the base currency of the company.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyInfo.CuryID
member.summary: Identifier of the of this Currency Info object.
member.value: Defaults to the base currency of the company.

member.summary: The read-only property providing the Currency for display in the User Interface.

member.summary: The identifier of the Rate Type associated with this object.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyInfo.CuryEffDate
member.summary: The date, starting from which the specified rate is considered current.
member.value: Defaults to the current business date.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyInfo.CuryMultDiv
member.summary: The operation required for currency conversion: Divide or Multiply.
member.value: Allowed values are: "M" - Multiply, "D" - Divide. Defaults to "M".

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyInfo.CuryRate
member.summary: The currency rate. For the purposes of conversion the value of this field is used together with the operation selected in the field.
member.value: Defaults to 1.0.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyInfo.RecipRate
member.summary: The inverse of the exchange rate, which is calculated automatically.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyInfo.SampleCuryRate
member.summary: The exchange rate used for calculations and determined by the values of the , and fields.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyInfo.SampleRecipRate
member.summary: The inverse of the . This value is also determined by the values of the , and fields.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyInfo.CuryPrecision
member.summary: The number of digits after the decimal point used in operations with the amounts associated with this Currency Info object and expressed in its currency.
member.value: The value of this field is taken from the field of the record associated with the currency of this object.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyInfo.BasePrecision
member.summary: The number of digits after the decimal point used in operations with the amounts associated with this Currency Info object and expressed in its base currency.
member.value: The value of this field is taken from the field of the record associated with the base currency of this object.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyList
member.summary: Contains general properties of the currencies that are stored in the system and are used during registration of documents across all modules. The DAC provides such information as code, description, and precision, which are required for amounts given in a particular currency. Financial settings associated with the currency (such as various accounts and subaccounts) are stored separately in the records of the type. Records of this type are edited on the Currencies (CM202000) form (which corresponds to the graph).

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CM.CurrencyInfo
member.summary: Stores currency and exchange rate information for a particular document or transaction. Usually, there is an individual record of this type for each document or transaction that involves monetary amounts and supports multi-currency. The documents store a link to their instance of CurrencyInfo in the CuryInfoID field, such as . The exchange rate data for objects of this type is either entered by user or obtained from the records. Records of this type are either created automatically by the or explicitly inserted by the application code (such as in ). User must not be aware of existence of these records.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.CurrencyInfo.CuryInfoID
member.summary: Key field. Database identity. Unique identifier of the Currency Info object.

member.summary: When set to true, the system won't allow user to change the fields of this object.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.CurrencyInfo.BaseCalc
member.summary: When true, indicates that the system must calculate the amounts in the base currency for the related document or transaction. Otherwise the changes in the amounts expressed in the currency of the document won't result in an update to the amounts in base currency.
member.value: Defaults to true.

member.value: Defaults to the base currency of the company.

member.value: Defaults to the base currency of the company.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CM.CurrencyList
member.summary: Contains general properties of the currencies that are stored in the system and are used during registration of documents across all modules. The DAC provides such information as code, description, and precision, which are required for amounts given in a particular currency. Financial settings associated with the currency (such as various accounts and subaccounts) are stored separately in the records of the type. Records of this type are edited on the Currencies (CM202000) form (which corresponds to the graph).

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CM.CurrencyRateType

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CM.TranslationHistory
member.summary: Represents currency translation history. The records of this type are created together with details () by the currency translation process (). The header records store general results of the currency translation, including the dates, status, link to the resulting batch, and totals.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CM.TranslationHistoryDetails
member.summary: Represents the details of the currency translation history. The records of this type are created together with the header () by the currency translation process (). The detail records store the results of currency translation for a particular account and subaccount, including the currency and rate information, link to the resulting GL transaction, status, and amounts.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CM.TranslDef
member.summary: Represents the currency translation definition, which determines the parameters of translation, such as source and destination ledgers and currencies. Records of this type are accompanied by details of the type. Translation definitions are edited on the Translation Definition (CM203000) form backed by the graph.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CM.TranslDefDet
member.summary: Represents details of the currency translation definitions. Each record of this type specifies the way translation is performed for a particular range of accounts and subaccounts (in the scope of the corresponding master record of the type).

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CM.PXDBBaseCuryAttribute
member.summary: Extends by defaulting the precision property. If LedgerID is supplied than Precision is taken from the Ledger's base currency. If BranchID or CuryID is supplied than Precision is taken from the currency, corresponded to the Branch.BaseCuryID or Currency.CuryID. Otherwise Precision is taken from Currency that is configured for the currently selected Branch, that user works with (AccessInfo.BaseCuryID).

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CM.PXDBBaseCuryMaxPrecisionAttribute
member.summary: Extends by defaulting the precision property. If BranchID or CuryID is supplied than Precision is taken from the currency, corresponded to the Branch.BaseCuryID or Currency.CuryID. Otherwise system searchef for the max Precision for base currencies, set for Companies.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.INItemClass.TaxCalcMode
member.summary: The tax calculation mode, which defines which amounts (tax-inclusive or tax-exclusive) should be entered in the detail lines of a document. This field is displayed only if the field is set to true.
member.value: The field can have one of the following values: "T" (Tax Settings): The tax amount for the document is calculated according to the settings of the applicable tax or taxes.
