member.summary: Represents a Subitem (or subitem code). Subitems allow to track different variations of a product under one . Subitems are available only if the Inventory Subitems feature is enabled. The records of this type are created and edited through the Subitems (IN.20.50.00) screen (corresponds to the graph).

member.name: T:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem
member.summary: Represents Stock Items (have value and stored in a warehouse) and Non-Stock Items (not kept in a warehouse and immediately available for purchase). Whether the item is Stock or Non-Stock is determined by the value of the field. The records of this type are created and edited through the Stock Items (IN.20.25.00) (corresponds to the graph) and the Non-Stock Items (IN.20.20.00) (corresponds to the graph) screens.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.Selected
member.summary: Indicates whether the record is selected for mass processing.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.InventoryID
member.summary: Database identity. The unique identifier of the Inventory Item.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.InventoryCD
member.summary: Key field. The user-friendly unique identifier of the Inventory Item. The structure of the identifier is determined by the INVENTORY Segmented Key.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.StkItem
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that this item is a Stock Item.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.Descr
member.summary: The description of the Inventory Item.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.ItemClassID
member.summary: The identifier of the Item Class, to which the Inventory Item belongs. Item Classes provide default settings for items, which belong to them, and are used to group items.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.ParentItemClassID
member.summary: The field is used to populate standard settings of Inventory Item from Item Class when it's created On-The-Fly and not yet persisted.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.ItemStatus
member.summary: The status of the Inventory Item.
member.value: Possible values are: "AC" - Active (can be used in inventory operations, such as issues and receipts), "NS" - No Sales (cannot be sold), "NP" - No Purchases (cannot be purchased), "NR" - No Request (cannot be used on requisition requests), "IN" - Inactive, "DE" - Marked for Deletion. Defaults to Active ("AC").

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.ItemType
member.summary: The type of the Inventory Item.
member.value: Possible values are: "F" - Finished Good (Stock Items only), "M" - Component Part (Stock Items only), "A" - Subassembly (Stock Items only), "N" - Non-Stock Item (a general type of Non-Stock Item), "L" - Labor (Non-Stock Items only), "S" - Service (Non-Stock Items only), "C" - Charge (Non-Stock Items only), "E" - Expense (Non-Stock Items only). Defaults to the Type associated with the Item Class of the item if it's specified, or to Finished Good ("F") otherwise.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.ValMethod
member.summary: The method used for inventory valuation of the item (Stock Items only).
member.value: Allowed values are: "T" - Standard, "A" - Average, "F" - FIFO, "S" - Specific. Defaults to the Valuation Method associated with the Item Class of the item if it's specified, or to Standard ("T") otherwise.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.TaxCategoryID
member.summary: Identifier of the associated with the item.
member.value: Defaults to the Tax Category associated with the Item Class. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.TaxCalcMode
member.summary: The tax calculation mode, which defines which amounts (tax-inclusive or tax-exclusive) should be entered in the detail lines of a document. This field is displayed only if the field is set to true.
member.value: The field can have one of the following values: "T" (Tax Settings): The tax amount for the document is calculated according to the settings of the applicable tax or taxes. "G" (Gross): The amount in the document detail line includes a tax or taxes. "N" (Net): The amount in the document detail line does not include taxes.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.WeightItem
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that this item is a Weight Item.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.BaseUnit
member.summary: The Unit of Measure used as the base unit for the Inventory Item.
member.value: Defaults to the Base Unit associated with the Item Class. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.SalesUnit
member.summary: The Unit of Measure used as the sales unit for the Inventory Item. This field can be changed only if the Multiple Units of Measure feature is enabled. Otherwise, the sales unit is assumed to be the same as the Base Unit.
member.value: Defaults to the Sales Unit associated with the Item Class. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.PurchaseUnit
member.summary: The Unit of Measure used as the purchase unit for the Inventory Item. This field can be changed only if the Multiple Units of Measure feature is enabled. Otherwise, the purchase unit is assumed to be the same as the Base Unit.
member.value: Defaults to the Purchase Unit associated with the Item Class. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.DecimalBaseUnit
member.summary:
When set to false, indicates that the system will prevent enter of non-integer values into the quantity field for choosed Base Unit value.
Defaults to true

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.DecimalSalesUnit
member.summary:
When set to false, indicates that the system will prevent enter of non-integer values into the quantity field for choosed Sales Unit value.
Defaults to true

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.DecimalPurchaseUnit
member.summary:
When set to false, indicates that the system will prevent enter of non-integer values into the quantity field for choosed Purchase Unit value.
Defaults to true

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.Commisionable
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the system must calculate commission on the sale of this item.
member.value: Defaults to false.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.ReasonCodeSubID
member.summary: The identifier of the Suabaccount defined by the Reason Code, associated with this item.
member.value: Defaults to the Reason Code Sub. set on the Posting Class of the item. Corresponds to the field.

member.summary: The Subaccount used to record sales of the item.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.InvtAcctID

member.value: Defaults to the Inventory Account set on the Posting Class of the item. Corresponds to the field.

member.summary: The Subaccount used to keep the inventory balance, resulting from the transactions with this item. Applicable only for Stock Items (see ).

member.summary: The Subaccount used to record the cost of goods sold for this item when a sales order for it is released. Applicable only for Stock Items (see ).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.ExpenseAccrualSubID
member.summary: The Subaccount used to keep the Expense Accrual Account, resulting from the transactions with this item. Applicable only for Non-Stock Items (see ).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.ExpenseAcctID
member.summary: The expense used to record the cost of goods sold for this item when a sales order for it is released. Applicable only for Non-Stock Items (see ).
member.value: Defaults to the COGS Account set on the Posting Class of the item. Corresponds to the field.

member.value: Defaults to the COGS Sub. set on the Posting Class of the item. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.StdCstRevAcctID
member.summary: The expense used to record the differences in inventory value of this item estimated by using the pending standard cost and the currently effective standard cost for the quantities on hand. Applicable only for Stock Items (see ) under Standard Valuation Method.
member.value: Defaults to the Standard Cost Revaluation Account set on the Posting Class of the item. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.StdCstRevSubID
member.summary: The Subaccount used to record the differences in inventory value of this item estimated by using the pending standard cost and the currently effective standard cost for the quantities on hand. Applicable only for Stock Items (see ) under Standard Valuation Method.
member.value: Defaults to the Standard Cost Revaluation Sub. set on the Posting Class of the item. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.StdCstVarAcctID
member.summary: The expense used to record the differences between the currently effective standard cost and the cost on the inventory receipt of the item. Applicable only for Stock Items (see ) under Standard Valuation Method.
member.value: Defaults to the Standard Cost Variance Account set on the Posting Class of the item. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.StdCstVarSubID
member.summary: The Subaccount used to record the differences between the currently effective standard cost and the cost on the inventory receipt of the item. Applicable only for Stock Items (see ) under Standard Valuation Method.
member.value: Defaults to the Standard Cost Variance Sub. set on the Posting Class of the item. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.PPVAcctID
member.summary: The expense used to record the differences between the extended price on the purchase receipt and the extended price on the Accounts Payable bill for this item. Applicable only for Stock Items (see ) under any Valuation Method except Standard.
member.value: Defaults to the Purchase Price Variance Account set on the Posting Class of the item. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.PPVSubID
member.summary: The Subaccount used to record the differences between the extended price on the purchase receipt and the extended price on the Accounts Payable bill for this item. Applicable only for Stock Items (see ) under any Valuation Method except Standard.
member.value: Defaults to the Purchase Price Variance Sub. set on the Posting Class of the item. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.POAccrualAcctID

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.POAccrualSubID
member.summary: The Subaccount used to accrue amounts on purchase orders related to this item. Applicable for all Stock Items (see ) and for Non-Stock Items, for which a receipt is required.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.PackSeparately
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the item must be packaged separately from other items. This field is automatically set to true if By Quantity is selected as the PackageOption. Applicable only for Stock Items (see ).
member.value: Defaults to false.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.PackageOption
member.summary: The option that governs the system in the process of determining the optimal set of boxes for the item on each sales order. Applicable only for Stock Items (see ).
member.value: Allowed values are: "N" - Manual, "W" - By Weight (the system will take into account the Max. Weight allowed for each box specififed for the item), "Q" - By Quantity (the system will take into account the Max. Quantity allowed for each box specififed for the item. With this option items of this kind are always packages separately from other items), "V" - By Weight and Volume (the system will take into account the Max. Weight and Max. Volume allowed for each box specififed for the item). Defaults to Manual ("M").

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CS.ArmGLHistoryByPeriod
member.summary: The DAC used to simplify selection and aggregation of proper records on various inquiry and processing screens of the General Ledger module. The main purpose of this DAC is to close the gaps in GL history records, which appear in case GL history records do not exist for every financial period defined in the system. To close these gaps, this projection DAC calculates the last activity period for every existing financial period, so that inquiries and reports that produce information for a given financial period can look at the latest available record.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier
member.summary: Represents a Carrier used by the company for shipping goods or a company's own shipping option. The records of this type are created and edited through the Ship Via Codes (CS.20.75.00) screen (Corresponds to the graph). If the feature is enabled, the corresponding settings and plugins are defined through the Carriers (CS.20.77.00) screen (Corresponds to the graph).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.CarrierID
member.summary: Key field. A unique code of a non-integrated carrier, a method of the integrated carrier or a shipping option of the company.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.CalcMethod
member.summary: The method used to calculate freight charges using the rate breakdown specified in the related records.
member.value: Allowed values are: "P" - Per Unit, "N" - Net (flat rates), "M" - Manual. Defaults to Manual ("M").

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.Description
member.summary: The description of the carrier or shipping option.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.TaxCategoryID
member.summary: Identifier of the Tax Category to be applied to the freight amount when goods are shipped with this shipping option.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.CalendarID
member.summary: The Calendar associated with the carrier, which reflects its work hours and the days when it ships the goods.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.FreightSalesAcctID
member.summary: Identifier of the General Ledger income , that is used to record the freight charges to be paid to the company.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.FreightSalesSubID
member.summary: Identifier of the General Ledger Subaccount, that is used to record the freight charges to be paid to the company.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.FreightExpenseAcctID
member.summary: Identifier of the General Ledger expense , that is used to record the freight charges to be paid to the Carrier.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.FreightExpenseSubID
member.summary: Identifier of the General Ledger Subaccount, that is used to record the freight charges to be paid to the Carrier.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.BaseRate
member.summary: The flat-rate charge, which is added to the freight amount calculated according to the related records. This field is relevan only if is set to false.
member.value: Defaults to 0.0.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.IsExternal
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the system must use a plugin, specified in the field, to provide integration with the carrier for this shipping option. This field is relevant only if the feature is enabled.
member.value: Defaults to false.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.CarrierPluginID
member.summary: Identifier of the used to provide integration with the carrier for this shipping option. This field is relevant only if is set to true.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.PluginMethod
member.summary: The code of the Service Method of the Carrier Plugin that is used to provide integration with the carrier for this shipping option. This field is relevant only if is set to true.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.ConfirmationRequired
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that to confirm the shipment the system will require confirmation for each package used for shipment with this shipment option. This field is relevant only if is set to true.
member.value: Defaults to true.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.PackageRequired
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that at least one package must be specified to create (and confirm) a shipment with this shipment option. This field is relevant only if is set to true.
member.value: Defaults to true.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.IsCommonCarrier
member.summary: Indicates whether the carrier is a common carrier. Because common carriers deliver goods from a company branch to the customer location that is a selling point, the value of this field affects the set of taxes that applies to the corresponding invoice.
member.value: When set to true, the carrier is considered common and hence the taxes from the customer's tax zone are applied. Otherwise, the system applies the taxes from the taz zone associated with the selling branch.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.NoteID
member.summary: Identifier of the Note object, associated with the document.
member.value: Corresponds to the Note.NoteID field.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CS.Terms
member.summary: Represents Credit Terms used for Accounts Payable and Accounts Receivable documents. The records of this type are created and edited through the Credit Terms (CS.20.65.00) (corresponds to the graph).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.TermsID
member.summary: Key field. Unique identifier of the Credit Terms record.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.Descr
member.summary: The description of the Credit Terms.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.VisibleTo
member.summary: Determines the categories of Business Accounts, for whom these terms can be used.
member.value: Allowed values are: "AL" - All, "VE" - Vendors only, "CU" - Customers only, "DS" - Disabled (can't be selected for Business Accounts or documents of any module). Defaults to "AL" - All.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.DueType
member.summary: Determines the way the Due Date is calucalated for documents under these Terms.
member.value: Allowed values are: "N" - Fixed Number of Days, "D" - Day of Next Month, "E" - End of Month, "M" - End of Next Month, "T" - Day of the Month, "P" - Fixed Number of Days starting Next Month, "C" - Custom. Defaults to "N" - Fixed Number of Days.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.DayDue00
member.summary: Defines the first Due Date for the terms. The meaning of this field varies depending on the value of the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.DayFrom00
member.summary: The start day of the range, for which the Due Date of the document is set to the first due date. This field is relevant only for the Terms with Custom ("C") . Corresponds to a day of the month.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.DayTo00
member.summary: The end day of the range, for which the Due Date of the document is set to the first due date. This field is relevant only for the Terms with Custom ("C") . Corresponds to a day of the month.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.DayDue01
member.summary: The second Due Date used with Custom ("C") (see and ). Corresponds to a day of the month.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.DayFrom01
member.summary: The start day of the range, for which the Due Date of the document is set to the second due date. This field is relevant only for the Terms with Custom ("C") . Corresponds to a day of the month.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.DayTo01
member.summary: The end day of the range, for which the Due Date of the document is set to the second due date. This field is relevant only for the Terms with Custom ("C") . Corresponds to a day of the month.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.DiscType
member.summary: Defines how the system determines whether Cash Discount is applicable for a document under these Terms on a particular date .
member.value: Allowed values are: "N" - Fixed Number of Days, "D" - Day of Next Month, "E" - End of Month, "M" - End of Next Month, "T" - Day of the Month, "P" - Fixed Number of Days starting Next Month. Defaults to Fixed Number of Days ("N").

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.DayDisc
member.summary: The number of days or a particular day of the month (depending on the value of ), during/before which the Cash Discount is applicable for the document.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.DiscPercent
member.summary: The percent of the Cash Discount under these Terms.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.InstallmentType
member.summary: The type of installment.
member.value: Allowed values are: "S" - Single, "M" - Multiple. Defaults to Single ("S").

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.InstallmentCntr
member.summary: The number of Installments for these Terms. The field is relevant only if the is Multiple ("M").

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.InstallmentFreq
member.summary: The frequency of Installments for these Terms. The field is relevant only if the is Multiple ("M") and the is not Split by Percents in Table ("S").
member.value: Allowed values are: "W" - Weekly, "M" - Monthly, "B" - Semi-monthly (the second installment comes a half a month after the first one, and so on).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.InstallmentMthd
member.summary: The method, according to which the amounts of installments are calculated. The field is relevant only if the is Multiple ("M").
member.value: Allowed values are: "E" - Equal Parts, "A" - All Tax in First Installment (the total amount before tax is split equally between installments and the entire amount of tax is added to the first installment), "S" - Split by Percents in Table (the days and amounts of installments are defined by the related records).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.PrepaymentRequired
member.summary: Indicates that percent of the Sales Order's Prepayment is more than zero.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.PrepaymentPct
member.summary: The percent of the Sales Order's Prepayment.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.DR.DRSchedule
member.summary: Encapsulates information about a deferred revenue or deferred expense recognition schedule produced by an Accounts Payable or an Accounts Receivable document line. The entities of this type are usually created automatically upon the release of the document line (see e.g. ) that has a deferral code specified. A user can also create a custom deferral schedule (or edit an existing one) by using the Deferral Schedule (DR201500) form, which corresponds to the graph.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.DR.DRSchedule.ScheduleID
member.summary: The unique integer identifier of the deferral schedule.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.DR.DRSchedule.DocType
member.summary: The type of the document that the deferral schedule corresponds to.
member.value: Corresponds to either the field or the field. This field can have one of the values defined by the or class.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.DR.DRSchedule.Module
member.summary: The module from which the deferral schedule originates.
member.value: This field can have one of the following values: "AR": Accounts Receivable, "AP": Accounts Payable. If the module specified is Accounts Payable, the record is a deferred expense recognition schedule. If the module specified is Accounts Receivable, the record is a deferred revenue recognition schedule. The value of this field depends on the value of the field.

member.value: Corresponds to either the or the field. This field can be empty for custom deferral schedules that are not attached to any document.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.DR.DRScheduleDetail
member.summary: Represents a revenue or expense recognition component of a deferral schedule. This entity encapsulates the inventory item component level information of the deferral schedule. Usually, deferral schedules contain a single component corresponding to the inventory item specified in the source document line. However, multiple components can be present in case the inventory item associated with the document line is a multiple deliverable arrangement (MDA), or when custom deferral components are added by the user. The entities of this type are edited on the Deferral Schedule (DR201500) form, which corresponds to the graph.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.DR.DRScheduleDetail.ScheduleID
member.summary: The unique identifier of the parent deferral schedule. This field is a part of the compound key of the record.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.DR.DRScheduleDetail.ComponentID
member.summary: The unique identifier of the inventory item (or one of its components, in case of a multiple deliverable arrangement) associated with the schedule component. This field is a part of the compound key of the record.
member.value: Corresponds to the field. If the schedule component originates from a document line with no inventory item specified, the value of this field is equal to .
member.remarks: Within a deferral schedule, there can be only one schedule component with equal to .

member.name: P:PX.Objects.DR.DRScheduleDetail.DetailLineNbr
member.summary: The line number of the component. This field is defaulted from the current value of the field of the parent deferred schedule.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.DR.DRScheduleDetail.Module
member.summary: The module associated with the schedule component. This field defaults to .
member.value: This field can have one of the following values: "AP": Accounts Payable, "AR": Accounts Receivable.
member.remarks: Any changes made to this field also affect the value of the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.DR.DRScheduleDetail.DefAmt
member.summary: The remaining deferred revenue or expense amount to be recognized upon the release of deferral transactions associated with the component.
member.value: For normal components, the value of this field is initially equal to , and is decreased during the /// revenue or expense recognition process (which is performed on the Run Recognition (DR501000) form). For residual components of multiple deliverable arrangement items (for which the flag is set to true), this value is zero because the amount is directly posted to the AP or AR account without deferral.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.DR.DRScheduleTran
member.summary: Represents a deferred revenue or expense recognition transaction. Encapsulates the amount to be recognized (or projected to be recognized) on a particular date and in a particular financial period. The entities of this type are created by upon the release of or document lines containing a deferral code. Deferral transactions can be added or edited by the user on the Deferral Schedule (DR201500) form, which corresponds to the graph.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.DR.DRScheduleTran.ScheduleID
member.summary: The identifier of the parent deferral schedule. This field is a part of the compound key of the record and is a part of the foreign key reference to .
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.DR.DRScheduleTran.LineNbr
member.summary: The line number of the deferral transaction. This field is defaulted from the current value of the field of the parent schedule component.
member.remarks: If the value of this field is equal to the value of of the parent schedule component, the deferral transaction is a "credit line transaction", which means that the whole deferral amount of the parent component should be posted to the deferred revenue or expense account. Otherwise, the deferral transaction is a normal deferred revenue or expense recognition transaction.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.DR.DRScheduleTran.BranchID

member.summary: The attribute sets and updates the underlying field that specifies whether the deferral terms are required for the current item. If property is set, the attribute verifies that the Term Start Date and Term End Date are present. If they are present, ensures that they are consistent with each other. Subscribes to the Field Updated event of Inventory ID, Start Date, and Deferral Code to set default dates and update the underlying field.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.FA.FixedAsset
member.summary: Contains the main properties of fixed assets and their classes. Fixed assets are edited on the Fixed Assets (FA.30.30.00) form (which corresponds to the graph). The fixed asset classes edited through the Fixed Asset Classes (FA.20.10.00) screen (corresponds to the graph).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.FA.FixedAsset.Selected
member.summary: An unbound service field, which indicates that the fixed asset is marked for processing.
member.value: If the value of the field is true, the asset will be processed; otherwise, the asset will not be processed.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.FA.FixedAsset.AssetID
member.summary: The identifier of the fixed asset. The identifier is used for foreign references; it can be negative for newly inserted records.
member.value: A unique integer number.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.FA.FixedAsset.RecordType
member.summary: A type of the entity: fixed asset, class, or element.
member.value:
The field can have one of the following values:
"C" indicates a fixed asset class.
"A" indicates a fixed asset.
"E" indicates a fixed asset element (also called component).

member.summary: A string identifier, which contains a key value. This field is also a selector for navigation.
member.value: The value can be entered manually or can be auto-numbered.

member.summary: A reference to the branch, .
member.value: An integer identifier of the branch. It is a required value. By default, the value is set to the identifier of the current branch.

member.summary: The base of the Fixed Asset, corresponds to the Base Currency of the Branch of Fixed Asset.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.FA.SubAccountMaskAttribute
member.summary: A subaccount mask that is used to generate the subaccounts of the fixed asset.
member.value:
The string mask for the SUBACCOUNT segmented key with the appropriate structure. The mask can contain the following mask symbols:
A The subaccount source is a fixed asset,
C The subaccount source is a fixed asset class,
L The subaccount source is a location,
D The subaccount source is a department,
By default, the mask contains only "C" symbols (which means that the only subaccount source is a fixed asset class).

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.PMAccountGroup
member.summary: Represents an account group that is used in projects. An account group is a group of GL accounts of the same type. Every GL account can be included in one and only one group of the same type as the account (Asset, Liability, Income, or Expense). It is also possible to create a non-accounting GL group, which can be used for collection and trace of any statistical information on the project that is not related to the financial area. Account groups are used to classify project budget and balance information. Essentially in the scope of a project, they play the same role as the GL account in terms of general ledger. Account groups are mapped to GL accounts to provide transfer and mapping of the project related financial information from the general ledger to projects. Account groups are not mapped to GL accounts one to one to reduce the number of account groups compared to the number of the natural GL accounts. The other reason is the ability to create non-financial account groups to enter and analyze the information that is not directly linked to finances.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.PMAddress
member.summary: Represents a billing address that is specified in the project for billing purposes. These settings are initially populated with the information specified on the Billing Settings tab of the Customers (AR303000) form (as a copy of the default customer location's address), but you can override any of the default settings. The record is independent of changes to the original address record. The entities of this type are created and edited on the Projects (PM301000) form (which corresponds to the graph)

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.PMAllocation
member.summary: Represents an allocation rule, which is used to temporarily allocate costs of a project to a WIP account. An allocation rule includes a sequence of steps. The records of this type are created and edited through the Allocation Rules (PM207500) form (which corresponds to the graph).

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.PMAllocationDetail
member.summary: Represents a step of the allocation rule that defines the calculation rules and allocation settings. The records of this type are created and edited through the Allocation Rules (PM207500) form (which corresponds to the graph).

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.PMOrigin.AccountGroupListAttribute
member.summary: List of available Account Group sources. Account Group can be taken either from Source object, from Account or specified directly.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.PMBilling
member.summary: Represents a billing rule. Billing rules are used to automate the calculation of amounts being billed to customers for a particular project and include a sequence of steps. The records of this type are created and edited through the Billing Rules (PM207000) form (which corresponds to the graph).

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.PMBillingRecord
member.summary: Represents a project billing record.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.PM.PMBillingRecord.ProjectID
member.summary: The identifier of the project associated with the record.
member.value: The value of this field corresponds to the value of the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.PM.PMBillingRecord.RecordID
member.summary: The sequence of line numbers of the records that belong to one project can include gaps.
member.value: Note that the sequence of line numbers of the records belonging to a single project may include gaps.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.PM.PMBillingRecord.BillingTag
member.summary: An internal field that is used during the billing to group and segregate transactions between billing rules, tasks, and invoices.
member.value: The field can have one of the following values: T: [PMTask.TaskID], if [PMTask.BillSeparately] is for the billed task. L: [PMTask.LocationID], if [PMTask.LocationID] is not equal to the location ID from the parent project. P: Otherwise.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.PM.PMBillingRecord.Date
member.summary: The date when the billing is applied.
member.value: Defaults to the current business date.

member.summary: The reference number of the parent pro forma invoice.

member.value: The value of this field corresponds to the value of the field.

member.summary: The reference number of the AR document that is created during the billing.
member.value: The value of this field corresponds to the value of the field.

member.summary: The sequence number of the invoice that is being assigned to the invoices of the project in order of the creation of the invoices.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.PMRevenueBudget
member.summary: Represents a project budget line with the Income type. The records of this type are created and edited through the Revenue Budget tab of the Projects (PM301000) form (which corresponds to the graph) and through the Revenue Budget tab of the Projects Templates (PM208000) form (which corresponds to the graph). The DAC is based on the DAC and extends it with the fields relevant to the lines of this type.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.PMChangeOrderClass
member.summary: Represents a change order class. Change order classes are used in change orders and define which project data (the revenue budget, the cost budget, or commitments) can be adjusted with a change order of this class. The records of this type are created and edited through the Change Order Classes (PM203000) form (which corresponds to the graph).

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.PMCommitment
member.summary: Represents a commitment. Commitments are created and updated during processing of purchase orders or subcontracts with detail lines related to a project. Also the records of this type are created through the External Commitments (PM209000) form (which corresponds to the graph). The records of this type are displayed on the Commitments (PM306000) form (which corresponds to the graph).

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.PMContact
member.summary: Represents a contact that is specified in the project and in the pro forma invoice. A record is a copy of customer location's and can be used to override the contact at the document level. The record is independent of changes to the original record. The entities of this type are created and edited on the Projects (PM301000) form (which corresponds to the graph) and on the Pro Forma Invoices (PM307000) form (which corresponds to the graph).

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.PMProforma
member.summary: Contains the main properties of a pro forma invoice. The records of this type are created during the project billing process and edited through the Pro Forma Invoices (PM307000) form (which corresponds to the graph).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.PM.PMProforma.RevisionID
member.summary: The revision number of the pro forma invoice, which is an integer that the system assigns sequentially, starting from 1.

member.summary: The reference number of the pro forma invoice.
member.value: The number is generated from the numbering sequence, which is specified on the Projects Preferences (PM101000) form.

member.summary: The application number.

member.summary: The description of the pro forma invoice, which is provided by the billing rule and can be manually modified.

member.summary: The read-only status of the document.
member.value: The field can have one of the following values: "H": On Hold, "A": Pending Approval, "O": Open, "C": Closed, "R": Rejected

member.summary: A counter of the document lines, which is used internally to assign numbers to newly created lines. We do not recommend that you rely on this field to determine the exact number of lines because it might not reflect the this number under various conditions.

member.summary: Specifies (if set to ) that the document has been released.

member.summary: The total amount to invoice of the time and material lines of the document in the base currency.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.PM.PMProforma.CuryProgressiveTotal
member.summary: The total amount to invoice of the progress billing lines of the document.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.PM.PMProforma.ProgressiveTotal
member.summary: The total amount to invoice of the progress billing lines of the document in the base currency.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.PM.PMProforma.CuryRetainageTotal
member.summary: The total retained amount.
member.value: Calculated as the sum of and .

member.name: P:PX.Objects.PM.PMProforma.RetainageTotal
member.summary: The total retained amount in the base currency.
member.value: Calculated as the sum of and .

member.name: P:PX.Objects.PM.PMProforma.CuryRetainageDetailTotal
member.summary: The total retained amount for the progress billing lines and time and material lines of the pro forma invoice.

member.summary: Represents a pro forma invoice line with the Progressive type. The records of this type are edited through the Progress Billing tab of the Pro Forma Invoices (PM307000) form. The DAC is based on the DAC and extends it with the fields relevant to the lines of this type.

member.summary: The reference number of the parent pro forma invoice.
member.value: The value of this field corresponds to the field.

member.summary: The type of the pro forma invoice line.
member.value: Defaults to the Progressive type.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.PM.PMProformaProgressLine.TaxCategoryID
member.summary: The identifier of the tax category associated with the pro forma invoice line.
member.value: Defaults to the tax category of the corresponding revenue budget line. The value of this field corresponds to the value of the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.PM.PMProformaProgressLine.CuryPreviouslyInvoiced
member.summary: The running total of the amount to invoice column for all the lines of preceding pro forma invoices that refer to the same revenue budget line. The preceding pro forma invoices are the pro forma invoices that have a reference number that is less than the reference number of the current pro forma invoice, and have the same project budget key (that is, the same project task, account group, and optionally inventory item or cost code).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.PM.PMProformaProgressLine.PreviouslyInvoiced
member.summary: The running total of the Amount to Invoice column in the base currency for all the lines of preceding pro forma invoices that refer to the same revenue budget line.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.PM.PMProformaProgressLine.PreviouslyInvoicedQty
member.summary: The running total of the Quantity to Invoice column for all the lines of preceding pro forma invoices that refer to the same revenue budget line.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.PMProformaTransactLine
member.summary: Represents a pro forma invoice line with the Transaction type. The records of this type are edited through the Time and Material tab of the Pro Forma Invoices (PM307000) form. The DAC is based on the DAC and extends it with the fields relevant to the lines of this type.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.PM.PMProformaTransactLine.RefNbr
member.summary: The reference number of the parent pro forma invoice.
member.value: The value of this field corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.PM.PMProformaTransactLine.Type
member.summary: The type of the pro forma invoice line.
member.value: Defaults to the Transaction type.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.PM.PMProformaTransactLine.CuryAmount
member.summary: The line amount.
member.value: Calculated by multiplying the values of Quantity to Invoice and Unit Price.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.PM.PMProformaTransactLine.CuryMaxAmount
member.summary: The billing limit amount (Maximum Amount) of the corresponding revenue budget line of the project. If no billing limit amount is defined for the revenue budget line of the project, the Max Limit Amount of each corresponding pro forma invoice line is 0.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.PM.PMProformaTransactLine.MaxAmount
member.summary: The billing limit amount (Maximum Amount) of the corresponding revenue budget line of the project in the base currency.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.PM.PMProformaTransactLine.CuryAvailableAmount
member.summary: The maximum amount available to bill the customer based on the billing limit amount of the corresponding revenue budget line of the project.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.PM.PMProformaTransactLine.AvailableAmount
member.summary: The maximum amount in the base currency available to bill the customer based on the billing limit amount of the corresponding revenue budget line of the project.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.PM.PMProformaTransactLine.CuryOverflowAmount
member.summary: The amount that exceeds the billing limit.
member.value: The amount is calculated as the difference between the Amount to Invoice and Max Available Amount. If this difference is negative - that is, if the Max Available Amount is greater than the Amount to Invoice - the Over-Limit Amount is 0. The invoice lines for which the Over-Limit Amount becomes nonzero exceed the limit.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.PM.PMProformaTransactLine.OverflowAmount
member.summary: The amount that exceeds the billing limit in the base currency.

member.summary: Used in Reports to calculate Previously invoiced amount.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.PMRate
member.summary: Represents a billing rate. Billing rates are used in the formulas of the billing and allocation rules for calculating the amount and quantity during the billing of a project or transaction allocation. The records of this type are created and edited through the Rate Tables (PM206000) form (which corresponds to the graph).

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.PMRateDefinition
member.summary: Represents a rate definition that is defined for a combination of a rate table and a rate type. The rate definition includes the sequence number and the types of factors to which the rate is applicable. The records of this type are created and edited through the Rate Lookup Rules (PM205000) form (which corresponds to the graph).

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.PMRateSequence
member.summary: Represents the combination of rate table, rate type, rate code, and rate sequence for which rates can be set. The records of this type are created and edited through the Rate Tables (PM206000) form (which corresponds to the graph).

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.PMRateTable
member.summary: Represents a rate table. Rate tables are used for configuring project billing rates. The records of this type are created and edited through the Rate Tables (PM204200) form (which corresponds to the graph).

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.PMRateType
member.summary: Represents a rate type. Rate types are used for configuring project billing rates. The records of this type are created and edited through the Rate Types (PM204100) form (which corresponds to the graph).

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.PMRecurringItem
member.summary: Represents a recurring billing line. Recurring billing line defines the rules the system uses to create the corresponding invoice line during the project billing. The records of this type are created and edited through the Project Tasks (PM302000) form (which corresponds to the graph), through the Project Template Tasks (PM208010) form (which corresponds to the graph), and through the Common Tasks (PM208030) form (which corresponds to the graph).

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.PMRegister
member.summary: Represents a batch of project transactions. The records of this type are created through the Project Transactions (PM304000) form (which corresponds to the graph), or can also originate from other documents.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.PM.PMSetup.ExpenseAccountSource
member.summary: The source for the expense account. When a cost transaction is created, the source is used to define the account.
member.value: The field can have one of the following values: "I": Labor Item, "P": Project, "T": Task, "E": Employee

member.name: P:PX.Objects.PM.PMSetup.ExpenseSubMask
member.summary: The subaccount mask that defines the rule of choosing segment values for the expense subaccount to be used for non-stock items on data entry forms in the Project Accounting module. To set up the rule, select a segment, press F3, and choose a source of the segment value, which is one of the following options:
member.value: The mask may include the following characters: I: Expense subaccount associated with non-stock item J: Subaccount associated with project T: Subaccount associated with project task E: Subaccount associated with employee For a segment, the characters designating each option are repeated as many times as there are characters in the segment.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.PM.PMSetup.ExpenseAccrualAccountSource
member.summary: The source of the account for the credit side of the project transaction to be generated on release of the time cards.
member.value: The field can have one of the following values: "I": Labor Item, "P": Project, "T": Task,

member.name: P:PX.Objects.PM.PMSetup.ExpenseAccrualSubMask
member.summary: The subaccount mask that defines the rule of selecting segment values for the expense accrual subaccount to be used for non-stock items on data entry forms in project accounting.
member.value: The mask can include the following characters: I: The expense subaccount associated with the non-stock item J: The subaccount associated with the project T: The subaccount associated with the project task E: The subaccount associated with the employee For a segment, the characters designating each option are repeated as many times as there are characters in the segment.

member.summary: The default price markup for estimation lines of change requests.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.PM.PMSetup.CutoffDate
member.summary: The cut-off date for billing.
member.value: The field can have one of the following values: "I": Include, which means to include all unbilled transactions with earlier dates and with the date of the invoice. This is the default value. "E": Exclude, which means to include all unbilled transactions with dates that are earlier than the date of the invoice.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.PM.PMSetup.OverLimitErrorLevel
member.summary: The option that defines how the system validates the limits of the revenue budget of a project when you process pro forma invoices for the project.
member.value: The field can have one of the following values: "W": Warning, whitch is the default value. "E": Error.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.PM.PMSetup.CostBudgetUpdateMode
member.summary: The way the system updates the cost budget of projects when a project transaction is posted, a change order line is released, a commitment line is saved, a pro forma invoice line is saved, an accounts receivable invoice line is saved, or a new change request line is saved or linked to a change order.
member.value: The field can have one of the following values: "D": Detailed, which is the default value. "S": Summary.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.PM.PMSetup.BudgetControl
member.summary: The way the system controls the project budget on document entry.
member.value: The field can have one of the following values: "N": Do Not Control, which is the default value. "W": Show a Warning.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.PM.PMSetup.RevenueBudgetUpdateMode
member.summary: The way the system updates the revenue budget of projects when a project transaction is posted, a change order line is released, a commitment line is saved, a pro forma invoice line is saved, an accounts receivable invoice line is saved, or a new change request line is saved or linked to a change order.
member.value: The field can have one of the following values: "D": Detailed, which is the default value. "S": Summary.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.PMTask
member.summary: Represents the smallest identifiable and essential piece of a job that serves as a unit of work, and as a method of differentiating between the various components of a project. A task is always defined within the scope of a project. The task budget, profitability and balances are monitored in scope of account groups.

member.summary: Primary Key

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.BaseProjectTaskAttribute
member.summary: Task Selector that displays all Tasks for the given Project. Task Field is Disabled if a Non-Project is selected; otherwise mandatory. Task Selector always work in pair with Project Selector. When the Project Selector displays a valid Project Task field becomes mandatory. When This selector is used in pair with and a Contract is selected Task is no longer mandatory. If Completed Task is selected an error will be displayed - Completed Task cannot be used in DataEntry.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.SOFreightDetailTask
member.summary:
Task Selector that displays all active Tasks for the given Project. Task Field is Disabled if a Non-Project is selected; otherwise mandatory. Task Selector always work in pair with Project Selector. When the Project Selector displays a valid Project Task field becomes mandatory. If Completed Task is selected an error will be displayed - Completed Task cannot be used in DataEntry.
Task is mandatory only if the Freight amount is greater then zero.

member.name: M:PX.Objects.PM.PMAddressAttribute.#ctor(System.Type,System.Type)
member.summary: Internaly, it expects PMAddress as a IAddress type.
member.param:
Must have type IBqlSelect. This select is used for both selecting
a source Address record from which AR address is defaulted and for selecting default version of POAddress,
created from source Address (having matching ContactID, revision and IsDefaultContact = true)
if it exists - so it must include both records. See example above.

member.summary: Ctor. Internaly, it expects PMContact as a IContact type
member.param:
Must have type IBqlSelect. This select is used for both selecting
a source Contact record from which AR Contact is defaulted and for selecting version of PMContact,
created from source Contact (having matching ContactID, revision and IsDefaultContact = true).
- so it must include both records. See example above.

member.name: M:PX.Objects.PM.PMBillEngine.Bill(System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.String)
member.summary: Run billing procedure for specified project.
member.param: Project ID billing procedure is being run for.
Date invoices should be created on. Procedure finds out the value based on the project data if null.

Financial period invoices should be create in. Procedure finds out the value based on the project data if null. If not null, the value may be treated differently depending on MultipleCalendarsSupport feature. If the feature is turned on, the value is treated as a master calendar financial period. Otherwise, the value is treated as the organization related period.
member.returns: Billing procedure result

member.name: M:PX.Objects.PM.RegisterReleaseProcess.AddToUnbilledSummary(PX.Data.PXGraph,PX.Objects.PM.PMTran)
member.summary: Increases the counter of unbilled transactions. Billed and Reversed transactions are ignored. Note: Although the method will add all necessary caches to the views collection of the graph to be saved on persist. This will work only if the graph is persisted within the context of current request. If there will be graph load/unload between this call and the Persist please add the required Caches to the graph manualy.

member.name: M:PX.Objects.PM.RegisterReleaseProcess.SubtractFromUnbilledSummary(PX.Data.PXGraph,PX.Objects.PM.PMTran)
member.summary: Decreases the counter of unbilled transactions. Only Billed or Reversed transactions are processed. Note: Although the method will add all necessary caches to the views collection of the graph to be saved on persist. This will work only if the graph is persisted within the context of current request. If there will be graph load/unload between this call and the Persist please add the required Caches to the graph manualy.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PO.POAddress
member.summary: Represents an address that is used in purchase order management.
member.remarks:
An address state is frozen at the moment of creation of a purchase order. Each modification to the original address leads to the generation of a new revision of the address, which is used in the new purchase order or in the overridden address in an existed purchase order. If the field is , the address has been overridden or the original address has been copied with the revision related to the moment of creation. Also this is the base class for the following derived DACs:
, which contains the information related to shipping of the ordered items
, which contains the information about the vendor to supply the ordered items
The records of this type are created and edited on the Purchase Orders (PO301000) form (which corresponds to the graph).

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PO.PO.NumberingAttribute
member.summary:
Specialized version of the AutoNumber attribute for POOrders
It defines how the new numbers are generated for the PO Order.
References POOrder.docType and POOrder.docDate fields of the document,
and also define a link between numbering ID's defined in PO Setup and POOrder types:
namely POSetup.regularPONumberingID, POSetup.regularPONumberingID for POOrderType.RegularOrder, POOrderType.DropShip, and POOrderType.StandardBlanket,
and POSetup.standardPONumberingID for POOrderType.Blanket and POOrderType.Transfer

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PO.POCreateProjectionAttribute
member.summary:
Specialized version of the Projection Attribute. Defines Projection as
a select of INItemPlan Join INPlanType Join InventoryItem Join INUnit Left Join INItemSite
filtered by InventoryItem.workgroupID and InventoryItem.productManagerID according to the values
in the POCreateFilter:
1. POCreateFilter.ownerID is null or POCreateFilter.ownerID = InventoryItem.productManagerID
2. POCreateFilter.workGroupID is null or POCreateFilter.workGroupID = InventoryItem.productWorkgroupID
3. POCreateFilter.myWorkGroup = false or InventoryItem.productWorkgroupID =InMember{POCreateFilter.currentOwnerID}
4. InventoryItem.productWorkgroupID is null or InventoryItem.productWorkgroupID =Owened{POCreateFilter.currentOwnerID}

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PO.POLineTypeListAttribute
member.summary:
Specialized PXStringList attribute for PO Order Line types.
Provides a list of possible values for line types depending upon InventoryID
specified in the row. For stock- and not-stock inventory items the allowed values
are different. If item is changed and old value is not compatible with inventory item
- it will defaulted to the applicable value.
[POLineTypeList(typeof(POLine.inventoryID))]

member.name: M:PX.Objects.PO.POLineTypeListAttribute.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Ctor, short version. List of allowed values is defined as POLineType.GoodsForInventory, POLineType.NonStock, POLineType.Service, POLineType.Freight, POLineType.Description
member.param: Must be IBqlField. Represents an InventoryID field in the row

member.name: M:PX.Objects.PO.POLineTypeListAttribute.#ctor(System.Type,System.String[],System.String[])
member.summary: Ctor. Shorter version. User may define a list of allowed values and their descriptions List for hidden values is defined as POLineType.GoodsForInventory, POLineType.GoodsForSalesOrder, POLineType.GoodsForReplenishment, POLineType.GoodsForDropShip, POLineType.NonStockForDropShip, POLineType.NonStockForSalesOrder, POLineType.NonStock, POLineType.Service, POLineType.Freight, POLineType.Description - it includes all the values for the POLine types.
member.param: Must be IBqlField. Represents an InventoryID field in the row
List of allowed values labels. Will be shown in the combo-box in UI

member.name: M:PX.Objects.PO.POLineTypeListAttribute.#ctor(System.Type,System.String[],System.String[],System.String[],System.String[])
member.summary: Ctor. Full version. User may define a list of allowed values and their descriptions, and a list of hidden values.
member.param: Must be IBqlField. Represents an InventoryID field of the row
Labels for the allowed values. List should have the same size as the list of the values
List of possible values for the control. Must include all the values from the allowedValues list
Labels for the possible values. List should have the same size as the list of the values

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PO.POLineInventoryItemAttribute
member.summary:
Specialized for POLine version of the CrossItemAttribute.
Providing an Inventory ID selector for the field, it allows also user
to select both InventoryID and SubItemID by typing AlternateID in the control
As a result, if user type a correct Alternate id, values for InventoryID, SubItemID,
and AlternateID fields in the row will be set.
In this attribute, InventoryItems with a status inactive, markedForDeletion,
noPurchase and noRequest are filtered out. It also fixes INPrimaryAlternateType parameter to VPN
This attribute may be used in combination with AlternativeItemAttribute on the AlternateID field of the row
[POLineInventoryItem(Filterable = true)]

member.summary: Default ctor

member.summary: The purpose of this handler is to workaround situations where exception was thrown in RowUpdated event chain and formulas that are embedded inside SOTaxAttribute will fail to calculate totals. Resetting totals to null will force formulas to calculate on all the details rather then calculate on the difference from previous incorrect result.

member.value: Given in the currency of deduction.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.RUTROT.BranchRUTROT.RUTExtraAllowanceLimit

member.value: Given in the currency of deduction.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.RUTROT.BranchRUTROT.ROTDeductionPct

member.name: P:PX.Objects.RUTROT.BranchRUTROT.ROTPersonalAllowanceLimit

member.name: T:PX.Objects.SO.SOAddress
member.summary: Represents an address that is used in sales order management.
member.remarks:
An address state is frozen at the moment of creation of a sales order. Each modification to the original address leads to the generation of a new revision of the address, which is used in the new sales order or in the overridden address in an existed sales order. If the field is , the address has been overridden or the original address has been copied with the revision related to the moment of creation. Also this is the base class for the following derived DACs:
, which contains the information related to shipping of the ordered items
, which contains the information related to shipping of the ordered items
, which contains the information related to billing of the ordered items
The records of this type are created and edited on the following forms:
Invoices (SO303000) (which corresponds to the graph)
Shipments (SO302000) (which corresponds to the graph)
Sales Orders (SO301000) (which corresponds to the graph)

member.name: T:PX.Objects.SO.SOContact
member.summary: Represents a contact that is used in sales order management.
member.remarks:
An contact state is frozen at the moment of creation of a sales order. Each modification to the original address leads to the generation of a new revision of the contact, which is used in the new sales order or in the overridden contact in an existed sales order. If the field is , the contact has been overridden or the original contact has been copied with the revision related to the moment of creation. Also this is the base class for the following derived DACs:
, which contains the information related to shipping of the ordered items
, which contains the information related to shipping of the ordered items
, which contains the information related to billing of the ordered items
The records of this type are created and edited on the following forms:
Invoices (SO303000) form (corresponds to the graph)
Shipments (SO302000) form (corresponds to the graph)
Sales Orders (SO301000) form (corresponds to the graph)

member.name: T:PX.Objects.SO.SOInvoiceNbrAttribute
member.summary:
Specialized for SOInvoice version of the InvoiceNbrAttribute.
The main purpose of the attribute is poviding of the uniqueness of the RefNbr
amoung a set of documents of the specifyed types (for example, each RefNbr of the ARInvoice
the ARInvoices must be unique across all ARInvoices and AR Debit memos)
This may be useful, if user has configured a manual numberin for SOInvoices
or needs to create SOInvoice from another document (like SOOrder) allowing to type RefNbr
for the to-be-created Invoice manually. To store the numbers, system using ARInvoiceNbr table,
keyed uniquelly by DocType and RefNbr. A source document is linked to a number by NoteID.
Attributes checks a number for uniqueness on FieldVerifying and RowPersisting events.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.SO.SOTaxAttribute
member.summary:
Specialized for SO version of the TaxAttribute.
Provides Tax calculation for SOLine, by default is attached to SOLine (details) and SOOrder (header)
Normally, should be placed on the TaxCategoryID field.
Internally, it uses SOOrder graphs, otherwise taxes are not calculated (tax calc Level is set to NoCalc).
As a result of this attribute work a set of SOTax tran related to each SOLine and to their parent will created
May be combined with other attrbibutes with similar type - for example, SOOpenTaxAttribute

member.summary: Check if per-unit tax amount sign should be inverted. For checks the same conditions for sign invertion as the method override.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.SO.SOLocationAvailAttribute
member.summary: Extends and shows the availability of Inventory Item for the given location.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.SO.SOLineInventoryItemAttribute
member.summary:
Specialized for SOLine version of the CrossItemAttribute.
Providing an Inventory ID selector for the field, it allows also user
to select both InventoryID and SubItemID by typing AlternateID in the control
As a result, if user type a correct Alternate id, values for InventoryID, SubItemID,
and AlternateID fields in the row will be set.
In this attribute, InventoryItems with a status inactive, markedForDeletion,
noSale and noRequest are filtered out. It also fixes INPrimaryAlternateType parameter to CPN
This attribute may be used in combination with AlternativeItemAttribute on the AlternateID field of the row
[SOLineInventoryItem(Filterable = true)]

member.name: P:PX.Objects.TX.DAC.TaxTranForReporting.Sign
member.summary: Sign of TaxTran with which it will adjust net tax amount. Consists of following multipliers: - Tax type of TaxTran: - Sales (Output): 1 - Purchase (Input): -1 - Document type and module: - AP - Debit Adjustment, Voided Quick Check, Refund: -1 - Invoice, Credit Adjustment, Quik Check, Voided Check, any other not listed: 1 - AR - Credit Memo, Cash Return: -1 - Invoice, Debit Memo, Fin Charge, Cash Sale, any other not listed: 1 - GL - Reversing GL Entry: -1 - GL Entry, any other not listed: 1 - CA: 1 - Any other not listed combinations: -1

member.name: T:PX.Objects.TX.Tax
member.summary: Represents a tax.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.TX.Tax.TaxID
member.summary: The tax ID. This is the key field, which can be specified by the user.

member.name: F:PX.Objects.TX.Tax.descr.MaxLength
member.summary: define tax description maximum length.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.TX.Tax.Descr
member.summary: The description of the tax, which can be specified by the user.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.TX.Tax.TaxType
member.summary: The type of the tax.
member.value: The field can have the following values: "S": Sales tax. "P": Use (purchase) tax. "V": Value-added tax (VAT). "W": Withholding.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.TX.Tax.TaxCalcType
member.summary: The basis of the tax calculation.
member.value: The field can have the following values: "D": A tax is calculated on a document basis. "I": A tax is calculated on a per-line basis.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.TX.Tax.TaxCalcLevel
member.summary: The tax level.
member.value: The field can have the following values: "0": An inclusive tax. "1": A first-level exclusive tax. "2": A second-level exclusive tax.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.TX.Tax.TaxCalcRule
member.summary: The aggregated rule of tax calculation based on and .
member.value: The field can have the following values: "I0": The tax amount is included in item amounts and should be extracted. "I1": The tax is a first-level tax calculated on item amounts. "I2": The tax is a second-level tax calculated on item amounts. "D1": The tax is a first-level tax calculated on the document amount. "D2": The tax is a second-level tax calculated on the document amount.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.TX.Tax.TaxCalcLevel2Exclude
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the system should exclude the first-level/per unit tax amount from the tax base that is used for calculation of the second-level tax amount in case of first-level taxes or all other taxes in case of per unit taxes. The flag is applicable to only first-level and per unit taxes.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.TX.Tax.TaxApplyTermsDisc
member.summary: The method of calculating the tax base amount if a cash discount is applied.
member.value: The field can have the following values: "X": Reduce the taxable amount. "P": Reduce taxable amount on early payment. "N": Do not affect taxable amount.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.TX.Tax.PendingTax
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the tax is a pending VAT. The pending VAT should be calculated in documents, but should not be recorded in the tax report. Later the VAT of the pending type can be converted into the general VAT.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.TX.Tax.ReverseTax
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the tax is a reverse VAT. When the reverse VAT is applied to a company that supplies goods or service to other EU countries, the liability of reporting VAT is reversed and goes to the customer rather than to the vendor.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.TX.Tax.IncludeInTaxable
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the VAT taxable amount should be displayed in the VAT Taxable Total box in the documents, such as bills and invoices.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.TX.Tax.ExemptTax
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the calculated amount should be displayed in the VAT Exempt Total box in the documents, such as bills and invoices.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.TX.Tax.StatisticalTax
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the tax is a statistical VAT. The statistical VAT is calculated for statistical purposes; the VAT is reported but not paid.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.TX.Tax.DirectTax
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the tax can be entered only by the documents from the Tax Bills and Adjustments form (TX303000).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.TX.Tax.DeductibleVAT
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the tax is a deductible VAT, which means that a company is allowed to deduct some part of the tax paid to a vendor from its own VAT liability to the government.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.TX.Tax.ReportExpenseToSingleAccount
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the non-deductible part should be posted to the Tax Expense account.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.TX.Tax.taxUOM
member.summary: The unit of measure used by tax. Specific/Per Unit taxes are calculated on quantities in this UOM.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.TX.Tax.TaxUOM
member.summary: The unit of measure used by tax. Specific/Per Unit taxes are calculated on quantities in this UOM

member.name: T:PX.Objects.TX.TaxTran
member.summary:
Represents a tax transaction. The entity serves for the following two purposes simultaneously:
To report the tax amount, which is stored in the TaxTran record, to a tax period. A tax report is built by TaxTran records, and reportable TaxTran records belong to the specified tax period after the tax report is prepared.
To store the tax amount of the document for each applied tax.

member.value: If the record is related to a document, the field contains the type of the document. In other cases, the field contains one of the following values: TFW: GL tax record TRV: GL tax record INT: Output tax adjustment RET: Input tax adjustment VTI: Input VAT VTO: Output VAT REI: Reverse input VAT REO: Reverse output VAT

member.name: M:PX.Objects.TX.TaxCalendar`2.CreateByIndependentTaxCalendar(PX.Objects.TX.TaxCalendar.CreationParams)
member.summary: Creates and records based on specified tax calendar periods configuration (not on financial periods).
member.param: The key of a master record.
The key of a tax agency ().
Defines starting a day and a month of the target year and a year if the previous year does not exist.
